Since no sixth candidate is in race, all five candidates looked set to get elected unopposed.

While the scrutiny of papers will be done on Monday, the five candidates would be deemed as elected unopposed on March 18, the last day of withdrawal of nomination papers. Otherwise, the election date was due on March 26.

“I feel grateful to CM Nitish Kumar for selecting a common man and sending him to the Rajya Sabha,” Harivansh said. It would be his second term in the Rajya Sabha.

“The CM has been paying attention to improving the social and economic reality of the dalits, socially backward sections and economically deprived groups. He has become their voice,” Ram Nath said.

Vivek said the BJP has always been a party of committed workers and honoured them. He also thanked the party’s central and state leadership for selecting him for the Rajya Sabha. Later, he was given a rousing welcome at the party’s state headquarters. “The mood of the party workers was upbeat,” state BJP spokesman Nikhil Anand said.

Title: All universities should follow PU in disbursal of retiral benefits: Lokayukta
Content:
Patna University

PATNA: The Patna University (PU) administration on Friday got a shot in the arm from the office of the Lokayukta for timely disbursement of retiral benefits to its teachers and non-teaching staff.

In its communication to PU, the office of the Lokayukta has stated that the report submitted by PU registrar should now be made a role model for the registrars of all other universities in the state inasmuch as the payment of retiral benefits is being claimed to be made to each and every retiring employee on the date of retirement itself.

In fact, the university has also taken a lead in the matter of fixation of pay revision and consequential revision of basic pension as per the 7th Pay Committee recommendations, the report says.

The report further states that there is only one pending case of an Urdu teacher, who could not be paid his retiral benefits due to non-submission of his pension papers even after seven years of his retirement, shows the splendid efforts made by the officials and employees of PU in achieving almost zero level of pendency of retirement benefit cases. “As a matter of fact, when repeated notices have been issued to the teacher concerned and even then he has failed to comply with the orders passed by PU by way of submission of pension papers, nothing more is required to be done in this case except publication of a press communiqué in the newspaper giving one last opportunity to him to fulfil the requisite condition for receiving the retiral benefits. And, if he still fails to do so, his case will not be treated as a pending case,” the report says.

PU vice-chancellor Rash Bihari Prasad Singh, when contacted, told the newspaper that as desired by the Lokayukta, a press communiqué demanding pension papers from the retired Urdu department teacher would be published in the local newspapers soon. And, PU officials would report the matter to the office of the Lokayukta on Monday, he said.

PU has already started making payment of revised salaries and pension to the working and retired employees respectively and the arrears of difference for the period from April 2019 till date would be paid along with the salaries and pension of March. The state government is also likely to release funds for payment of arrears of revised pay and pension with effect from January 2016 to March 2019, the VC added.

Title: New vehicle sales in city hit recession roadblock
Content:
Surat: The ongoing recession in the diamond , real estate and textile sectors coupled with cash crunch in the market has affected purchase of new vehicles.

This is evident from the data of vehicle registrations the Surat Regional Transport Office (RTO), which is struggling to achieve its annual target of revenue collection.

The registration of new vehicles fell by nearly 18% in the city between April-February, 2020 and it is likely to further drop by the end of March.

Against the annual revenue target of Rs 475 crore in 2019-20, the RTO has been collected Rs 290 crore till February, falling short of Rs 185 crore.

“We won’t be able to achieve the target this time due to the sharp fall in the registration of new vehicles. Most of our revenue comes from the motor vehicle tax, but in 2019-20, the sale of vehicles has dropped 18%,” said in-charge regional transport officer, DK Chavda.

According to Chavda, the overall revenue collection of RTO comes from motor vehicle tax, licence fees, passenger tax, compounding fees and other fees.

Industry sources said that the situation of automobile sector is worrisome and few dealers have also closed their showrooms in the last one year.

Amish Mali, CEO of a leading automobile brand, told TOI: “At least dealers have shut down their showrooms in the last one year. The purchasing power of the people in the city has gone due to various factors including inflation, market slowdown etc.”

Mali added, “There is a flat 28% GST on the car and that the customers have to pay 20% cess on buying cars below 1500 CC and 23% on those above 1,500 CC. The price of cars have increased in the recent past, which has come as a major deterrent for the customers.”

Mehul Soni, owner of a two-wheelers dealership, said, “Crisis in the diamond, textile and real estate sectors has badly hit purchases. Also, the implementation of BS-VI vehicles has led to prices of vehicles increase by Rs 8,000 to Rs 10,000. There is nearly 30% drop in the sales of two-wheelers”

Title: Engg student dies in road mishap
Content:
Hyderabad: A BTech student succumbed to accident injuries after he lost control of his rented two-wheeler inside the JNTU Campus, on early hours of Friday. The victim was identified as Muneeb Basheer, Mechanical Engineering student. He was staying at Kinnera Boy’s Hostel in campus.

According to police, the victim was proceeding to attend Namaz prayers when he lost control of the two-wheeler and fell. He was rushed to Prathima Hospital, where he succumbed to injuries. A case was registered under Section 304-A of the IPC.

In another incident, a GHMC sanitation worker, Lingamaiah, 49, died after being hit by a tipper heading to Vijaywada on the National Highway on Friday morning. A case was registered.

Title: Rupee rebounds from new lows as RBI gives Rs 25k cr support
Content: Mumbai: The rupee rebounded from a record low of 74.49 to close 31 paise higher at 73.91 against the dollar following a recovery in the stock markets and RBI ’s announcement that it will provide funds to banks to offset the shortage of liquidity caused by its sale of dollars.At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened lower at 74.39 and slid further to the day’s low of 74.49 as the BSE sensex crashed by over 3,000 points before triggering the circuit breaker. The rupee recovered sharply to 73.91, up 31 paise against the dollar, as the RBI’s measures were seen to be supporting the Indian currency.The forex markets were also reassured by the RBI’s statement on ensuring normalcy. “The RBI is closely and continuously monitoring the rapidly evolving global situation and will take all necessary measures to ensure that money, debt and forex markets remain adequately liquid and stable, and continue to function normally,” the RBI said in a statement, while announcing a Rs 25,000-crore, seven-day repo auction. IFA Global founder & CEO Abhishek Goenka said, “The panic in equities did not snowball into currencies to the same extent. The central bank has done a good job of containing volatility so far. After making a lifetime low of 74.49 levels, the dollar-rupee pair retraced to 74 mark on visible regulatory interventions. A weekly close on either side of the range 73.75-74.50 will guide further direction.”Foreign institutional investors have pulled out over $5 billion from the equity markets this month. While the RBI has a large stash of dollars with which it can defend the rupee, it is using the reserves to stem the volatility by ensuring a constant supply of dollars at the market rate.Despite the RBI’s announcement of a repo to ease liquidity, yield on the 10-year bond inched up as a continuing global lockdown is expected to turn international investors risk-averse. The dollar continued to gain against emerging market currencies.Meanwhile, the US Federal Reserve said it would give banks $1.5 trillion. But the announcement failed to have a positive impact on markets, which were spooked by the travel restrictions. “Dollar index stood tall as investors scrambled for the world’s most liquid currency amid deepening panic about the coronavirus , while the euro nursed losses after ECB disappointed by not cutting rates,” said SMC Investments in a report.According to A Prasanna of ICICI Securities Primary Dealership, the RBI’s out-of-turn repo auction suggests that it is proactive in addressing market dislocations as they arise. “The central bank would also be well advised to put in place contingency plans for smooth functioning of financial markets in case the virus outbreak hits closer home in Mumbai,” he said.

Title: With just 2-3 months worth of raw material, industry hopes Covid-19 threat subsides soon
Content:
Panaji: Goa’s industrial sector will face a severe crunch in raw material supply in the coming two to three months if the emerging threat of coronavirus (Covid-19) does not subside, said Goa Chamber of Commerce and Industry President Manoj Caculo here on Friday.

While the tourism sector has already been hit by the spread of the virus, the manufacturing sector is yet to press the panic button.

“Production is not affected as raw material continues to come in. But if this continues, and it doesn’t get corrected soon, demand will drop and production will get affected. At present people have stock to last another two or three months. However, if any industry is dependent on raw material from outside the country, like China, they will not be able to sustain for more than that as raw material will totally be in short supply by then,” Caculo said.

He was speaking to reporters in Panaji after a function organised by the income tax department to create awareness about the centre’s “Vivad se Vishwas” scheme.

Caculo said that while tourism has already felt the impact of the virus outbreak, the retail and auto sector are also showing a decline.

“The retail industry is suffering as people are avoiding going out to public places,” Caculo said.

Caculo also said the sales of four and two-wheelers has remained poor with dealers struggling to sell vehicles with BS4 engines.

“The four-wheeler sector is not affected much, but the stock of two-wheelers is a lot and it seems difficult that it will be sold by March-end. The auto industry is dependent on components coming from China and Thailand, so production could be affected, but since demand is low, production is also low,” he said.

Title: Amazon, Swiggy execs to work from home too
Content:
Bengaluru: Online food delivery company Swiggy , fintech startup KhataBook and vernacular content platform Dailyhunt are among the latest set of startups that have mandated work-from-home for their employees starting Monday, founders and spokespersons confirmed to TOI.

E-commerce giant Amazon has also “recommended” that its employees start working from home from Friday till the end of March, expecting most of them to use the option and only those who have urgent work to come to office.

Swiggy, whose delivery service will continue, has over 7,000 corporate employees, while Dailyhunt has about 500 employees and KhataBook has 80. Amazon has an estimated employee base of over 50,000 in India with major offices in Bengaluru and Hyderabad. Flipkart , which had asked employees to work from home from Wednesday to Friday, has also extended the policy for the next week.

Several startups like online brokerage Zerodha , education technology platform Unacademy, social commerce platform Meesho and bike rental company Bounce had announced mandatory work-from-home policy for their employees on Thursday.

The development comes at a time when the Karnataka government has announced shutting down of malls, cinema halls, pubs, schools, colleges and all other mass gathering events across the state for a week, starting from Saturday. In another development, a Google employee in Bengaluru tested positive for Covid-19 on Thursday.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Masks, sanitizers in short supply in Patna
Content: PATNA: There is acute shortage of masks and sanitizers in the city market following steep rise in their demand in view of coronavirus (Covid-19). Soaps and different brands of handwash are also in high demand.There is also shortage of N95 masks and alcohol-based sanitizers. Diwakar Prasad, owner of a chemist shop near Gola Road, said people are buying masks and hand sanitizers in large numbers. “Taking precautions is all right, but stocking products at home is not advisable,” he said and added that there has been 80% rise in the demand of self-hygiene products. “The alcohol-based sanitizers at my shop are out of stock. Besides, there are very few N95 masks left in stock,” Prasad said.Malls and supermarkets are also finding it difficult to meet the increasing demands of hand sanitizers. In addition, soaps, handwash, mosquito repellent cream, wipes, roll-ons, coils, mats, vaporisers and sprays are in high demand following the rumours about the spread of Covid-19.Ghanshyam, a sales executive in a mall on Boring Road, said, “Earlier, people in the city didn’t take the virus seriously, but after seeing so many positive cases in several parts of the country, they have become conscious. No wonder, we are facing shortage of self-hygiene products, especially hand sanitizers, soaps and handwash.”Wholesalers also made similar claims about the shortage of sanitizers and other products “There has been a higher demand of personal care products in the last fortnight. Earlier, people asked for simple sanitizers but now they look for alcohol-based ones,” said Kumud Sao, a wholesaler of Kadamkuan.Residents also feel scarcity of masks and hand sanitizers following the rise in Covid-19 cases in the country. “Last night I went to buy masks for my family and myself, but the seller offered me a very low quality mask at a very high price. The government should provide sufficient numbers of self-hygiene products in every city,” said Sanjay Kumar of Lohanipur.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Pune: Zilla Parishad cancels health department staffers leaves
Content: PUNE: Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad has cancelled the leaves of health department staffers for the next few days in the wake of the spurt in coronavirus cases.Prasad said if the situation demands even the weekly offs of employees would be cancelled.He said action would be taken against those missing from office. The Public Healthcare Centres (PHCs) are in special focus and the staff members have been asked to track patients who have visited the centre in the past one-and-a-half month. The probable cases will be identified, and their health checked. A control room has been set up at the tehsil office.Prasad said, “Not a single employee of the health department will go on leave unless there is an emergency. Leaves of all health officials have been cancelled and this should be treated as an emergency situation. If any officer is found missing from work, action will be taken against him/her.”Prasad has instructed all PHCs to prepare a localisation plan to contain the virus in their jurisdiction. The Asha workers have been instructed to conduct house-to-house surveys and note the travel history of residents from January, especially those with a travel history.

Title: HUL’s 4,000 office staff to work out of home from Tuesday
Content: MUMBAI: In an unprecedented move, global consumer products company Unilever has directed all office-based employees to work from home starting Tuesday, March 17, as a safety measure and to minimise the spread of Covid-19 In compliance with the parent company’s directive, Hindustan Unilever ’s offices across India will also go into a ‘work from home’ mode beginning Tuesday, until further directions are issued.This, however, does not apply to sales people and factory workers. The move could prompt more organisations to issue similar guidelines to contain the pandemic.In response to a TOI query, HUL CMD Sanjiv Mehta said, “As the risk of infection is currently heightened, we have taken several measures to minimise employee exposure and ensure they as well as their families are safe. As a global business, our teams consistently work in an agile manner, meaning we already have robust systems in place. The company has decided to implement ‘work from home’ for all office-based employees starting March 17.”HUL’s total strength in India is around 18,000 employees, of which office-based employees — who will be covered under the ‘work-from-home’ guideline — are over 4,000 in number. “Our first priority is the safety of our employees, who we’ve been regularly communicating with and sharing the precautionary measures we all need to take, while ensuring business continuity,” said Mehta. With revenues of over Rs 38,000 crore, HUL is a leading fast-moving consumer goods company and India is the second-largest market for the $58-billion Unilever whose products are sold in 190 countries.As part of a new set of measures announced by Unilever to protect its people from coronavirus, CEO Alan Jope said, “All office-based employees globally should work from home. Any exceptions (which we expect to be few and far between, and most probably due to the need to access data-intensive systems) must be approved by the country general manager. The only country where this does not apply is in China, where people are beginning to return to work per national controls.”For its field sales employees, the guideline issued by the maker of brands like Dove, Knorr, Lipton and Ben & Jerry’s states they should connect with customers virtually wherever possible and minimise the use of public transport if a customer visit is necessary. “Strict protocols on social distancing (including non-physical greetings), and hand hygiene (especially after handling cash) will also be put in place and will be communicated shortly,” it said.“Since the initial outbreak in China, we have put in place measures to help minimise the risk from coronavirus to our employees and their families. Our approach has been one of abundant caution, and the speed of response and collective responsibility I have seen across Unilever has been truly heroic,” said Jope.

Title: Umarkhadi may become Gujarat’s first ‘avoidable blindness free’ village
Content:
Avoidable blindness is the blindness which can either be treated or prevented by known and cost-effective mean... Read More

MANDVI (SURAT): Umarkhadi , a tiny village , 80 km from Surat city , is set to become the first ‘avoidable blindness free’ village in Gujarat .

Avoidable blindness is blindness which can either treated or prevented by known and cost-effective means, according to International Agency for Prevention of Blindness.

A pilot project, which was initiated by Mandvi-based DivyaJyoti Trust-run Tejas Eye Hospital in this tribal village, is about to completed in the next few days.

“We had selected Umarkhadi which has 320 households with a total population of 970 to make it free of avoidable blindness. Last month, our team screened 897 villagers and the remaining 77 are being screened periodically as they are migrant workers. Of the total 897 screened, about 40% (363 people) were found to have some or the other eye problems,’’ said Dr. Uday Gajiwala, an ophthalmologist and superintendent of Tejas Eye Hospital.

Dr Gajiwala said 140 villagers were given ready made spectacles while 13 were provided tailor-made glasses.

“On checking the blood sugar of 160 people, four were found to be diabetic. We had taken photos of eye fundus (interior lining that includes retina) of 124 people of which three patients found to have abnormalities. We had given medicines to 59 people who had minor eye problems. In all, 17 villagers were referred for cataract operations of which 11 have been done,” he added.

All patients were screened and treated free of cost by the hospital.

“The idea behind the project was to prevent avoidable blindness through intensive efforts as people may neglect the eye-related problems due to lack of awareness and poverty. Out of the total blindness in the country, 80 percent blindness is avoidable and we can prevent. People visit the hospital only when eye problem becomes severe and its too late by then,’’ Dr Gajiwala added.

Chunuben Vasava, 70, a resident of Umarkhadi, said, “I was suffering from eye sight problem, but did not go to hospital. But during screening, doctors found I had cataract and I was operated the next day.”

Title: Two of gang looting passengers in autorickshaw held
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: Police have arrested two members of a gang involved in looting passengers travelling in the autorickshaw on Friday.

Imran Sattar Shaikh alias Jawari (28), a resident of Ichhaba society in Limbayat and Allarakha Aziz Shaikh alias Allu (24), a resident of Kamrunnagar also in Limbayat, were nabbed by the crime branch sleuths following specific information.

The police recovered the autorickshaw used in the crime, mobile phones and cash worth Rs 1.32 lakh from the possession of the accused.

A case was registered in the Limbayat police station on March 10 where a 65-year-old man was looted of cash, mobile phone, gold chain worth Rs 81,000 by the duo near Mithikhadi in Limbayat.

The victim had boarded the autorickshaw from Sahara Darwaja to go to Limbayat on on March 10. The duo drove the auto to a deserted spot near Mithikhadi and threatened the victim at knife-point and asked him to hand over cash and other valuables. The frightened victim gave all his belongings including cash, mobile, gold chain to the accused.

Sources said that Jawari is wanted in three cases registered in different police stations of the city.

The modus operandi of the victim was to hunt for a lone passenger between the railway station and Sahara Darwaja wanting to hire auto during the early morning hours. The passenger would be taken to deserted spot and looted after brandishing weapon.

Sub-inspector of crime branch, P M Vala said, “The accused were targeting single passengers. We had launched search operation to nab the accused. On the specific information, the duo were arrested from Limbayat.”

Title: Surat: Robbery accused held after 21 years
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: An accused wanted in a 21-year-old robbery case was arrested by the city crime branch from Sachin on Friday.

Ramsagar alias Sagar Ramnarayan Pal (48), a resident of Gokulnagar in Sachin was employed as textile worker at the Jasmit Silk Mills at Sachin GIDC in 1999. The accused left the job after few months of joining and allegedly planned robbery with few of his accomplices at the mill.

On January 22, 1999, the accused and his accomplices Sunil Jaiswal , Jitendra alias Pappu Singh, Ajay Bengali, Mohammed Nizam and Shanker Mohapatra , struck at the mill at late night with weapons. The security guard and few workers inside the mill were taken hostage and that the accused broke open the lock of the cupboard where the cash for the workers’ wages was kept by the mill owner.

Police sources said that the accused escaped with Rs 4.70 lakh cash from the cupboard and was on the run since then.

Police sub-inspector, crime branch C R Desai said, “A case of robbery was registered in the Sachin police station in 1999. The police was on the lookout for the accused involved in the robbery case, but could not find him. However, the crime branch sleuths had gathered specific information on the accused and that he was arrested from Sachin.”

Title: Surat: Players oppose common GST rate for textile sector
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: The textile players in Surat has opposed the proposed move to rationalise tax rate at the GST Council meeting.

A meeting was organised at the Jash textile market at Ring Road on Friday where the leaders from the powerloom weaving sector, textile traders and knitters opposed the proposed move to rationalise the GST rate in the textile sector.

Sources said that the GST council meeting will be held on Saturday where they have selected few sectors including textile for the rationalisation of GST tax rate at 12%.

The industry stakeholders stated that there are two tax slabs in the man-made fabric (MMF) sector including 12% on polyester yarn and 5% on the fabric. The powerloom weavers, traders and knitters fall under the 5% tax bracket of the GST. However, the common rate in the sector will increase the fabric cost for the end consumers.

President of Federation of Gujarat Weavers’ Association (FOSTTA) said, “The tax rationalisation move by the GST council is only going to hurt the MMF textile sector. The industry is comfortable with the 5% tax slab and that any further increase would destabilise the sector.”

Hari Kathiria, member of FOGWA said, “If the rates are revised then the industry will be facing lot of hardships in terms of sustaining the fabric prices. This will result in unemployment and closure of the powerloom units as well.”

Title: Sarpanch’s husband booked for casteist slur
Content:
Representative image

RAJKOT: Husband of a woman sarpanch in Samadhiyala village of Botad taluka was booked on Friday for allegedly hurling casteist slurs at a Dalit man on Wednesday.

Police said when Amit Dhandhal (18) went to the house of the woman sarpanch to get her signature on the Aadhar card application form, her husband Lakshman Khandiwala (55) allegedly hurled casteist slurs at him.

“Your very presence outrages the sanctity of my house. Even your grandfather stands outside the courtyard of our house,” Khandiwala allegedly said to Dhandhal. Earlier in the day, when Dhandhal had approached Khandiwala, the latter had asked him to get his identification proof.

“Second time when Dhandhal approached Khandiwala, he had kept the video camera of his cellphone on, suspecting that he would be abused for his caste. Dhandhal told his father Naran, who after consulting with community leaders decided to lodge an atrocity complaint against Khandiwala,” said R B Karamatiya, inspector with Botad police station.

In the video, Khandiwala is heard telling Dhandhal ‘to stay within his limit.’ He was peeved with the Dalit man for venturing into his verandah where a jug of water was kept.

Karamatiya said that the complaint would be transferred to the SC/ST Cell of Botad police which would carry out further investigation.

Title: Man rapes, impregnates minor stepdaughter
Content:
Representative image

RAJKOT: The police are hunting for a 40-year-old ‘stepfather’ who has allegedly raped and impregnated his 16-year-old stepdaughter in Navagam locality on the outskirts of Rajkot.

The crime came to light after the survivor was diagnosed with four-month-old pregnancy. The survivor’s mother lodged a complaint against the accused on Thursday night.

The mother took the survivor to a private hospital when the latter had taken ill, and the doctors there asked them to go for pregnancy tests. “After the survivor’s test confirmed pregnancy, her mother quizzed her and the minor girl revealed the ordeal she had been facing for the past two years. The girl alleged that the man had been threatening to kill her if she complained about the crime to anyone. As soon as the complaint was lodged in this connection, we launched a manhunt for the accused,” said A J Lathiya, sub-inspector with Rajkot mahila police station.

The accused hails from Nepal and the survivor’s mother married him after her first husband walked out on her, 13 years ago. The survivor was three years old then. Soon both mother and daughter started to live with the accused and the mother also has a child from the accused.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Bihar: A new device to fill trains with water in just six minutes
Content:
An East Central Railway train

PATNA: In a bid to streamline railway traffic, the East Central Railway (ECR) successfully tested a new ‘quick watering device’ installed at Pt Deendayal Upadhaya (DDU) Junction on Thursday. The new device is likely to reduce detention of long distance passenger trains to fill water.

ECR chief public relations officer (CPRO) Rajesh Kumar said the new device was successfully tested on the Danapur-New Delhi Jansadharan Express (13257) and Pt Deendayal Upadhaya Junction-Ara-Sasaram passenger (54271) when the full rakes of these two trains were automatically filled with water in hardly six minutes at the DDU Junction. “In normal case, it takes at least 10 to 15 minutes to fill water manually in the coaches of passenger trains,” he said.

The CPRO said DDU Junction was the first choice for the railways for installation of the new device as a large number of passenger trains pass through it. “DDU Junction is also the inter-change point for several mail and express trains coming from Eastern Railway, Northern Central Railway, Northern Railway and Western Railway. It has been observed that in case of late running of passenger trains, manual water filling process further delays trains. The new device will prove a boon as far as punctuality of trains is concerned,” the CPRO added.

He said the water filling process can be carried out simultaneously in four to five passenger trains at the DDU Junction through the new device. “Everything is computerised and controlled though remote. The new device also gives a hint about the exact requirement of water in each coach,” the CPRO added.

Special trains: Railways has decided to run superfast special train (02365/02366) between Patna and Anand Vihar to cope with passengers’ rush post Holi. While the special train will leave Patna Junction on Sunday at 8.25pm and reach Anand Vihar next day at 2.20pm, it will leave Anand Vihar on Monday at 6.45pm and reach Patna next day at 12.30pm on its return journey. Another special train (05533/05534) will run between Saharsa and Ambala. It will leave Saharsa on Sunday at 7pm and reach Ambala the next day at 12.15am.

Bharat Darshan train: Union minister of state for health Ashwani Kumar Choubey on Friday welcomed pilgrims travelling in the Bharat Darshan special train at Buxar station falling under Danapur division of the East Central Railway (ECR). Choubey said Buxar has historical importance and a place to visit for tourists. He also inaugurated a newly built VIP lounge on platform number 1 at Buxar station. Danapur divisional railway manager Sunil Kumar, senior divisional commercial manager Aadhar Raj, senior divisional engineer Sujit Jha, senior RPF commandant S K S Rathore and other railway officials were present on the occasion. The special train, which left Delhi on March 5, will cover several important tourist places in the eastern region of the country.

Title: NIT-P boy tops GATE in electrical engg
Content:
PATNA: Abhash Rai, a final year BTech student of National Institute of Technology (NIT), Patna, has secured All India Rank (AIR) 1 in electrical engineering (EE) in the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) examination. The results were announced by the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi on Friday evening.

A farmer’s son, Abhash (22) cracked the examination in the first go and scored 87.33% marks. The overjoyed Abhash said no one had expected me to get the top rank. “I was quite sure to be in top 100 scorers, but I had never expected to top the exam. I’m very happy to make my parents proud,” he told this newspaper. “I told my parents about the results and they are very happy. They are sharing the news with all the friends and relatives in the village and here in Patna as well,” he said.

Born to Bhupendra Nath Rai and Saroj Rai (homemaker), Abhash wants to work in public sector undertakings. “Based on the GATE score, I would apply for jobs in National Thermal Power Corporation Limited and Power Grid Corporation of India. I have not decided much for the future, but I want to give a better life to my parents,” he said.

He has also got a job in L&T Company with Rs6.5 lakh per annum package through campus placement.

The boy hails from Narayanpur village in Ballia, Uttar Pradesh. He had completed his matriculation from MNB Memorial Public School, Ballia with 8.6 CGPA. He did his Intermediate from Holy Mission Senior Secondary School, Patna, with 90.6%. Later, Abhash cracked Joint Entrance Examination (All India Engineering Entrance Examination) and got admission in NIT, Patna. His elder brother Alok Rai works as an assistant in SBI branch at Ballia.

“For my higher education after matriculation, my mother moved to Patna. She always encouraged me to do better in my studies. She’s my source of inspiration. My father lives in Ballia and is involved in farming,” the topper said.

Abhash initially studied two to three hours for GATE after college hours. Later, he studied 7-8 hours for the exam. “For the last few months, I focused completely on GATE,” he said.

Title: Panic cancellations burn holes in tourists pockets
Content:
Rajkot: Rajkot-based businessman Shreyash Borad had booked a 17-day trip with his wife to France, Switzerland and Italy in April. After the Coronavirus scare and clampdown in Italy, he rushed to cancel his tickets and was successful in getting refund from the airlines only. Borad had to pay penalty for hotel and cancellations of the other reservations he had made.

However, many other travellers who had planned summer tours abroad aren’t as lucky as Borad. A few airlines and hotels are issuing customers credit notes against their cancellations which can be used in the future.

Chief executive of Transglob travels, Sanjay Mehta said, “The airlines are issuing refunds for cancellations till March 31, but uncertainty looms large for April and May. There are few airlines who are collecting cancellation charges in accordance to their booking policy and some in UAE, Middle East and Europe-bound airlines are issuing credit notes for April onwards cancellations.”

According to travel agents, tourists for USA have to apply for visa four months before intended visit and for the UK, six months before travel. People generally plan abroad tours during summer vacation in April-May and book their packages accordingly during November and December to benefit from cheaper air fares and hotel accommodations.

However, most of such hotels are now reluctant to issue refunds and are either charging cancellation fees or issuing credit notes. Europe train companies are also issuing credit notes and asking passengers to choose alternate dates. “In the prevalent panicky situation, people are not in a position to choose alternate dates and end up paying penalties,” Mehta added.

Secretary of Travel Agents Federation of India (TAFI), Manish Sharma said, “We are asking travel agents and passengers not to panic and cancel bookings. We are asking them to wait and watch till April and May.”

Sharma further said that because of the situation, agents’ money is also getting stuck as they block the seats in airlines and hotel rooms for a year.

According to travel agents, the panic has made people even cancel tours to nearby South East Asian countries like Indonesia and Malaysia.

On the contrary, these international cancellations have spurred domestic bookings.

Pratik Soni, a travel agent said, “We are getting more inquiries for Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh and Darjeeling and we are focusing on domestic tours this year. Tourists are avoiding South Indian destinations especially Kerala, one of the most favourite destinations in normal days.”

Title: Bus driver drops off schoolchildren, dies of heart attack
Content:
Nagpur: Suresh Dumbhare, 43, a school bus driver, did not allow his increasing uneasiness to overpower him after having suffered a possible cardiac arrest while driving back home at Bahadura phata. The driver ensured he parked the bus safely at the roadside on the busy Bahadura road before collapsing on the footpath and dying.

Dumbhare, engaged with a Mouda-based school, had nearly reached home when he is learnt to have started feeling discomfort in the stomach. The pain later shifted to the chest as he began having a choking feeling.

Dumbhare was barely half a kilometre from his home and he struggled to complete the last stretch. Sensing something seriously wrong and unable to cope with his condition, Dumbhare got out of the driver’s cabin after parking the bus along the side of the road. He collapsed on the footpath when a neighbour, Mahendra Kohale, saw him writhing and tried to help. But it was to no avail.

Dumbhare was the sole earning member of the family. His wife Archana is a housewife. They have two school-going children. Friends and neighbours stated the family lost its breadwinner and has none to look after the children and their education now. Dumbhare, who would leave home at 5.30 am, worked hard. He would drive around 27 km from the school to reach his place at 6 pm.

Kohale, speaking to TOI, said it appeared as if Dumbhare was suffering from an epileptic fit. “We assumed he was suffering from some kind of convulsions or fit. Initially we treid to revive him through traditional means like trying to make him smell onions and so on,” he said. “We rushed him to a local hospital but were referred to Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) where he was declared dead,” he said.

Sakkardara police were informed by the GMCH booth after Dumbhare was declared dead. Sakkardara police have registered the case as an accidental death.

Title: Surat’s ranking goes up one notch to 5th
Content:
Surat: Surat city’s ranking among smart cities improved as the union ministry of housing and urban affairs declared rankings after evaluation of certain projects.

Smart city ranking is continuing evaluation process, said Surat municipal commissioner Banchhanidhi Pani. “About three months ago, Surat was ranked 6th and on Friday it ranking went up one point to 5th position. Our ranking has improved because we have implemented important projects which were selected under the smart city mission,’’ added Pani.

The union government had selected 100 cities through a competitive process in four different rounds. These cities have over 5,000 projects worth Rs 2 lakh crore to be undertaken under the Smart City Mission.

Surat Smart City Mission has been chosen for city award for showing great momentum in the implementation of projects.

The award would be given during two-day meeting of Smart City Mission to be held in Jaipur from July 7. According to sources, Surat Smart City Mission had a total outlay of Rs 2,908 crore when it began on June 25, 2015.

Title: No gauge conversion of Talala-Visavadar line
Content:
Rajkot: The railway ministry is not planning to broad guage conversion of the Talala-Visavadar meter gauge line. The broad gauge was a part of Veraval-Talala-Visavadar conversion project, but the ministry has dropped this plan in order to protect the Asiatic lions in Gir.

This was informed by minister of railways and commerce and industry, Piyush Goyal, in Rajya Sabha on Friday. Goyal said this in response to a question from Rajya Sabha MP Parimal Nathwani who sought to know whether the gauge conversion of 72 km track between Talala and Visavadar passing through Gir wildlife areas will pose danger to the Asiatic Lions. Nathwani also wanted to know whether the government is mulling retaining the meter gauge railway line as a heritage railway line in view of its rich wildlife.

“Presently, it has been decided to retain this section as meter gauge due to forest issues as the alignment is passing through Gir reserve forest,” Goyal stated in his reply.

Railway has also reduced the speed of the train from 50km per hour to 30kmph between Talala and Veraval stations in Gir forest area so that driver can apply breaks to on seeing wild animals crossing the track. Goyal also said that the ministry is closely working with the the forest department regarding information of lion’s movement near the track.

Title: ‘Protection of women need of hour’
Content:
Panaji: Expressing sadness and shock over the recent abduction and rape of a school girl, Congress on Friday questioned the safety measures put in place to protect minors and women from sexual assault.

The state Mahila Congress committee president Pratima Coutinho said that it was shocking that a minor girl has been kidnapped and raped in the deputy chief minister’s constituency of Quepem.

“Students in schools are not safe. The message is going out that daughters and minor girls in schools and colleges are not safe. Rapes are increasing across the country. Law and order is not proper,” she said.

Congress said that despite several crimes against women, the government is deaf. “Where are the fast track courts? I ask CM Pramod Sawant to take steps to protect women and law and order,” she said.

She also said that parents need to bring up children with proper values and discipline. Congress also warned the government that if the accused in the rape case escapes, all officers involved should be arrested.

Title: No coronavirus screening facility at railway stations, bus stands in Patna
Content: PATNA: Despite global outbreak of Covid-19, people reaching the state capital from other parts of the country are not being screened at railway stations and bus stands here.Though several trains ply between the city and other states, thermal screening facility is yet to come up at railway stations here. Passengers too said they were not checked at Patna Junction for possible exposure to the virus. Sheetal Jain, who returned from New Delhi on Friday, said, “New Delhi is one of the affected cities with several positive cases of Covid-19. I was expecting a proper screening on my arrival at Patna Junction. However, nothing was done.”Danapur station director Nilesh Kumar said since lakhs of people arrive at the station from different parts of the country on a daily basis, it is not easy to check each and every passenger. “We have set up isolation wards and medical teams. Medical attendants were keeping a watch on passengers a fortnight ago. However, they stopped the exercise after finding no Covid-19 suspect,” he said.Kumar said the health department’s advisory was being displayed on two big screens at the railway station in order to make people aware about the virus.Even at Bankipore and Mithapur bus stands, screening facility was nowhere to be seen.Transport secretary Sanjay Kumar Agarwal, however, said all passengers travelling from New Delhi, districts bordering Nepal and other states would be screened from Saturday. “Screening facilities and help desks will come up at all bus stands in the city. Passengers reaching the city will be checked thoroughly by medical attendants. Special vigil will be kept on interstate buses and buses coming from districts bordering Nepal,” he said.Meanwhile, the state health department has installed a thermal screening camera at Jayaprakash Narayan International Airport here to check body temperature of passengers at the immigration point. Medical teams and help desks have been asked to check every passenger arriving at the airport.An airport official said more than 20,000 passengers have so far been screened at Patna and Gaya airports.However, Aniz Bakumstak, who returned to city from Kolkata on Friday, said screening was done at Kolkata airport, but not in Patna.

Title: Lightning strikes kill three in Rohtas village
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: Three persons were killed by lightning strikes in Sasaram as many places in Bihar witnessed showers and thunderstorm on Friday. Weathermen have claimed that the same weather is likely to continue over the next two days as well, though its intensity will gradually reduce.

With regard to deaths in Sasaram, additional district magistrate of Rohtas Lakshman Prasad told TOI that three persons were killed by the lightning strikes around 7am. “The process is underway for giving compensation to the family members of the deceased,” Prasad said.

According to sources, the deceased have been identified as Ramachela Rajwar (30), Guruchela Rajwar (55) and Rajaram Yadav of Gijuwahi village under Sasaram Mufassil police station.

Meanwhile, India Meteorological Department (IMD) stated in its evening bulletin that thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is expected on Saturday as well. The intensity of showers is likely to reduce on Sunday as IMD has predicted showers only at isolated places in Bihar.

Patna Meteorological Centre in its evening bulletin stated that light to moderate rainfall occurred at one or two places over Bihar during last 24 hours. The places which received significant rainfall included Gopalganj (23.4mm), Vaishali (17.4mm), Mashrakh in Saran district (15.4mm), Kesaria in East Champaran (11mm), Siwan (11mm), Chakia (10.4mm) and Patahi (8.7mm) in East Champaran.

The bulletin further stated that rainfall with thunderstorm is expected at a few places in the state on Saturday and one or two places on Sunday. Dry weather is expected to prevail Monday onwards.

The prevailing inclement weather has been attributed to a cyclonic circulation over east Uttar Pradesh along with an east-west trough line.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Pune: Rumours on social media hit poultry farmers, 1kg of live chicken sells for Rs 10
Content: PUNE: Desperate poultry farmers in various parts of the district are selling a kg of live chicken for as low as Rs10 following rumours on social media linking its consumption with Covid-19.The farmers said they were facing almost 100% loss in the business, as there was no demand for farm gate chicken. A few weeks ago, one kg of live chicken was being sold in the range of Rs80 to Rs90.“I have faced loss up to Rs10 crore in the past few weeks, as there is no demand for chicken in the market,” said Pramod Hinge, owner of Urja Poultry farm, which has registration of over 600 poultry farmers from Ambegaon, Khed, Manchar and Shirur.Hinge said, “Since there is no demand in the market, we load our chickens in vehicles and sell them in villages in Ambegaon tehsil at a very cheap rate,” he said.The animal husbandry department and the Indian Medical Association (IMA) have categorically said Covid-19 does not have any connection with chicken. “Since people had experienced bird flu virus in the past, they think that Covid-19 also spreads from chicken. Our staffers and farmers are reaching out to the people to improve the situation,” said Hinge, who is a member of the Poultry Breeders Welfare Association in Maharashtra, an independent body.Vasant Kumar Shetty, president of the association, said poultry farmers in Maharashtra have faced about Rs700 crore loss in the past few weeks. “Since chicken is a food item, we cannot stock it for long. We have to sell them at whatever prices we can. We were selling a kg of chicken for Rs70 a few weeks ago. The prices have now gone down to Rs10-Rs20 across the state,” he added.The Poultry Breeders Welfare Association in Maharashtra has sought help from the state. “The government should compensate us for our losses. We do not know how to repay our bank loans, electricity bills and other monthly expenses. We will also approach the Centre for compensation,” Kumar said.An animal husbandry department official said the lack of awareness and misleading information of social media platforms have created the panic situation among consumers. He said, “Unless people realize this, the condition will not enhance.”

Title: Gujarat: Leopard spotted 2km from Bharuch town, alert sounded
Content:
Forest officials said that the security personnel at the power company’s guest house, which is just 2km from B... Read More

SURAT: An alert has been sounded in the Bharuch town after a leopard was spotted near the Torrent Power guest house at Kukarvada on the embankment of Narmada river on Friday morning.

Forest officials said that the security personnel at the power company’s guest house, which is just 2km from Bharuch town, had spotted the leopard in the bushes on the river embankment.

This is first time that the leopard has strayed into the city limits of Bharuch. The official bungalows of the district superintendent of police (SP) and the collector are located few metres away from the spot where the leopard was spotted, said a forest official.

Talking with TOI, wildlife warden of Bharuch forest department, Ashish Sharma said, “This is first time that a leopard has ventured into the city limits. We have alerted the residents living close to the river embankment to take extra precaution and avoid getting out of their house after dusk.”

According to Sharma, the spot where the leopard was seen has dense bushes and is near the river embankment, which makes it difficult to locate the leopard.

Raj Patel, district forest officer (DFO) told TOI, “We have alerted the local residents about the presence of leopard. Cages have been placed to capture the big cat. We have also arranged night surveillance by the forest staff to keep a tab on the leopard.”

Title: Witness protection cell at Odisha crime branch office soon
Content:
Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The state government will set up a witness protection cell at the state crime branch ( CB ) office in Cuttack to ensure the successful implementation of the witness protection scheme-2019. It will be headed by the Crime Branch SP.

“I have declared the Crime Branch office as the witness protection cell of the state. It will remain dedicated to implement the scheme in letter and spirit. The Crime Branch SP will act as the nodal officer and coordinate with the district police,” director general of police (DGP) Abhay said on Friday. The DGP released an order in this regard on Wednesday.

“We will monitor court trial of sensitive cases, mostly crimes against women and ensure protection of the prosecution witnesses,” a Crime Branch officer said.

The state government had in July last year introduced the witness protection scheme, which envisages free and fair trial of cases in courts and extends protection to the prosecution witnesses from getting intimidated by accused or influential persons.

Crime Branch sources said fresh advisories might be issued for the superintendents of police (SPs), inspectors general of police (IGs) and deputy inspectors general (DIGs) of police ranges in the state about their roles and responsibilities for the complete implementation of the scheme.

The protection measures also ensure that a witness and the accused or his accomplices do not come face to face during investigation or trial. “We will urge police to install security devices in the home or office of a witness, whose identity should be concealed at all cost. There should be regular patrolling around a witness’s house or office. This apart, a witness should also be escorted to court from home and vice-versa amid tight security,” the officer added.

Notably, the witness protection scheme-2019 looks after three categories of shield for witnesses.

While category A consists of those cases where a witness or any of the family member faces threat for a long time to life during police investigation or court trial, category B deals with cases with lesser degree of risk to life and reputation of a witness. Category C cases bear moderate risk to life of a witness.

Title: Kolkata: ‘Former policeman’ smashes aunt’s head with hammer
Content:
Subhasis Dutta (left) being taken to court on Friday

KOLKATA: A man in his 40s — a former cop according to family members — was arrested for allegedly smashing his aunt’s head with a hammer at their Behala home on Thursday night. Namita Dutta, 65, was taken to a private hospital where she died in the early hours of Friday.

Police said Dutta was washing utensils on the ground floor of their house when her nephew Subhasis, 40, allegedly hit her from behind. Alerted by her cries, Dutta’s husb-and came running down the stairs and saw Subhasis continuing the assault even as Dutta bled. In his complaint, Dutta’s husband Phanindra Nath, 74, claimed he started calling for help.

Subhasis then went into his room and began drinking. Other relatives in the house called cops and took the woman to Vidyasagar state general hospital and then to a private hospital in Mominpore, where she succumbed to her injuries. Subhasis was initially arrested on charges of attempt to murder, which was turned into a case of murder. He was produced in an Alipore court on Friday and was remanded in police custody.

While family members claimed Subhasis was drunkard and had a nervous disorder along with signs of mental illness, cops claimed the attack was a fallout of a property dispute.

“It looks like Subhasis, whose parents were dead, was denied his share of the property by other members of the family and after a heated altercation, he attacked the woman. We are probing into the case to know more details,” said an officer.

Subhasis’s family members claimed he had joined the wireless division of Kolkata Police 16 years ago but stopped attending office for the past several years following his mental illness and nervous disorder. Cops, however, said they have not found any record of him being associated with the department till Friday evening. Cops said they have found a training completion certificate with a Kolkata Police logo at his home, but are yet to verify its authenticity.

Title: West Bengal: IIT-Kharagpur cancels classes, IIM-Calcutta pushes convocation back to avoid coronavirus risk
Content:
TimesView Kolkata is yet to get a single case but that may change, given the rising numbers in the rest of the country. But responsible behaviour — heeding all the guidelines laid down by health experts and government agencies — can contain the spread of this flu to a large extent. We must remember that a response feeding on panic will not help.

KOLKATA: IIT Kharagpur on Friday suspended academic activities till March 31 to avoid any suspected threat from Covid-19. IIM Calcutta has postponed the annual convocation, which was to be held on the Joka campus on April 4.“Students and campus residents have been advised not to leave the campus. Those students who live outside campus have been instructed to stay at home. Students will be able to avail of online facilities for classroom courses. Laboratory courses, however, would remain suspended until further notice,” the IIT circular stated. “The schools on the premises will also be suspended but the ongoing secondary and higher secondary examinations will be conducted as per schedule,” IIT director V K Tewari said in the circular.All seminars, conferences and workshops have also been postponed until further notice at IIT Kharagpur.At IIM Calcutta, this will be the first time in a decade when the institute has been forced to defer the convocation. In a notice issued by director Anju Seth on Friday evening, the institute stated that “in view of advisories issued by the ministry of health and family welfare and the WHO to avoid large gatherings ... it has been decided to defer the convocation.”The notice, however, doesn’t mention any other date when the convocation may be held. “Several other IIMs, including IIM Lucknow, IIM Indore and IIM Bangalore, have also deferred their convocations which were scheduled to be held this month.Several Kolkata schools on Friday issued circulars to parents about ensuring safety of students. South Point School spokesperson Krishna Damani said, “Handing over of report cards of the annual term of classes nursery-III, scheduled for March 17, has been deferred and fresh dates will be announced soon. Report cards for classes IV and V will be handed over to parents on March 24 and students will not be required to attend school on that date. An annual function of the school’s Saturday Activity Club, scheduled on March 21, has been deferred till further notice.” The school also postponed the showing of final-term answer papers to classes VI-VIII scheduled for March 16 to March 18.At the La Martiniere Schools, a notice was issued where guardians have been advised not to send their wards to school if they are down with fever, runny nose, cough or any infectious disease, till they completely recover and get a fitness certificate from a doctor.At Amity University, classes have been called off till March 31. “All face-to-face classroom activities on campus have been called off with effect from Saturday up to March 31. In lieu of the suspended on-campus classes, online classes will be scheduled from next week so that there is no academic loss,” the circular said.

Title: Coronavirus in Bihar: Leave of government doctors and health staff cancelled till March 31
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: The state health department has cancelled all leaves, including medical leave, of doctors and support staff of government hospitals till March 31 in view of coronavirus threat.

Sanjay Kumar, principal secretary of state health department, said an alert has been sounded in all districts.

Meanwhile, Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) medical superintendent Dr Bimal Kumar Karak said altogether three coronavirus suspects have been kept in the isolation ward of the hospital. “Of these, two have been tested negative and results of the third patients are awaited. Samples of more than 50 people from the state have been sent to National Institute of Virology for tests,” Dr Karak said.

Meanwhile, samples of a Covid-19 suspect from Samastipur, who was admitted in the isolation ward of PMCH, have been tested negative. “One more suspected patient from Darbhanga was admitted at PMCH on Friday,” Dr Karak said.

He added that PMCH has taken several precautionary measures to prevent the spread of the virus. “Even though no coronavirus case has been reported in the state so far, we are leaving no stone unturned to fight the outbreak. The isolation ward at PMCH was shifted from the emergency building to a cottage on Thursday. The first floor of the cottage, which has been converted into an isolation ward, has nine rooms with two beds each,” he said.

Meanwhile, a senior health department official said over 1.36 lakh passengers have been screened at transit points in the state till now. Besides, 19,095 people have been screened at Patna and Gaya airports. The official added that as many as 205 passengers who have returned from corona-affected countries have been kept in home isolation till now. Of these, 77 have completed 14-day quarantine.

State health officials said owners of hotels in all 38 districts, especially those in Gaya, Vaishali, Nalanda and Araria, have been asked to report any symptomatic case to the authorities concerned.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Bihar: RJD cancels training camp, LJP its programme
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: RJD called off its two-day training camp at Rajgir on March 14 and 15 as the allotment of the convention centre was cancelled after the state government announced several preventive measures against coronavirus on Friday.

LJP also cancelled its programme under ‘Bihar First Yatra’ scheduled at Madhepura and Saharsa on Saturday. LJP minority cell president Ashraf Ansari said the decision had been taken in view of coronavirus. He said the programme will be held soon.

Leader of opposition in the state assembly, Tejashwi Prasad Yadav said they had done all the preparation for the event. “Thousands of our workers had already reached there. But we were informed that the allotment of Rajgir Convention Centre had been cancelled,” said Tejashwi. He said the government should have given them special permission. “But we do not want to do politics over it,” he added.

When asked about talks going on to cancel the ongoing Budget session, Tejashwi said, “Personally, I want this session to continue. If legislators are not safe inside assembly, then what will common people will do. What about safety inside buses, at airports and railway stations.”

Title: Two days police custody for graft-tainted SMC officer
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: A special Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) court on Friday has remanded assistant engineer of the Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) arrested in the disproportionate asset (DA) case to two days police custody. The ACB sleuths had produced Rajesh Patel, 48 , in the special ACB court seeking his remand on Friday morning.

The ACB had booked Patel under the DA case on Wednesday following the inquiry ordered against him in 2016. The inquiry was initiated by the ACB after Patel was caught accepting bribe of Rs 25,000 from a builder for giving positive feedback for the construction project in Rander zone on February 25, 2016.

The accused, who is serving in the town planning department of SMC, had demanded bribe to give positive feedback for the construction project on a plot of a land in Rander zone. The complainant had approached ACB and lodged a complaint against the accused.

Sources said that the remand of the accused was sought on the ground of gathering information regarding the source of his income through which he amassed property and cash.

Title: Rajkot: Undertrial abuses magistrate, feigns illness to escape from custody
Content:
Morbi civil hospital from where he escaped

RAJKOT: An undertrial , accused in a molestation case , gave cops the slip from Morbi Civil Hospital on Thursday. Before doing a disappearing act, Mulji Solanki , allegedly hurled abuses at the chief judicial magistrate during hearing of his case, feigned illness by collapsing and slapped an advocate.

According to the details of the case, it all happened while Solanki was taken to Morbi court for hearing of his case. When the hearing started, the judge told Solanki to get his advocate, who was absent. Then the judge announced hearing of another case. This angered Solanki who asked the judge as to why he was not giving him the date for the next hearing. Solanki also allegedly hurled abuses at the judge.

“After hurling abuses, Solanki feigned illness by collapsing on the floor. The court staff called up the 108 ambulance. While Solanki was being taken on a stretcher, he got up and allegedly slapped and threatened advocate M R Oza,” said I M Kondia, inspector with Morbi B division police station.

“After he was taken to Morbi Civil Hospital, he gave the hospital staff the slip escaped from there,” he added.

Meanwhile, the advocates at all the courts in Morbi observed strike on Friday, demanding immediate arrest of Solanki.

Title: Three arrested for trying to extort Rs 1 lakh from Gondal trader
Content:
Representative image

RAJKOT: Three persons were arrested on Friday for allegedly extorting Rs 1 lakh from a trader in Chunara Sheri locality of Gondal in Rajkot district on Thursday.

Police said the accused, Azruddin Saiyed (30), Sikandar Memon (27) and Shehzad Memon (25), allegedly demanded the money from Chandrakant Tanna (54), saying they had been given a contract to kill him. And if Tanna wanted to save himself, he would have to pay the accused Rs 1 lakh.

According to the police, Tanna is into wholesale business of sugar and edible oil. On the fateful day, Saiyed came to Tanna’s shop in the afternoon and asked him to accompany him, telling him that he had some work with him.

Saiyed drove Tanna on his motorcycle to the compound of Sangramsinhji High School, where Sikandar and Shehzad were waiting for them.

Sikandar told Tanna about his ‘supari’ (contract to kill) and demanded the money to spare him. Then the accused dropped Tanna back at his shop. They then called Tanna twice in the evening, demanding the money.

“When Tanna discussed about the issue with his fellow traders, one of them told him that he had similarly fallen prey to this gang and that Sikandar had asked him to cough up Rs 25,000, telling him that he had got a supari to break his legs.

The trader said as one of his friends knew Sikandar and he told him not to harass him, the gangsters stopped his harassment.

“Hearing this, Tanna decided to lodge a complaint against the accused,” said K N Ramanuj, inspector with Gondal city police station.

The accused were arrested from their residences in Gondal.

Title: Patna HC overrules its order in elopement case
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: The Patna high court has overruled its previous judgment and ordered that in a case of elopement, a girl between 16 and 17 years will be sent to remand home and will not be allowed to live with the person of her choice.

Sending of a minor girl to protection home, remand home or ‘nari niketan’ by a judicial order in elopement case can’t be treated as illegal confinement giving rise to a remedy under habeas corpus writ, the court ordered on March 5. A full bench comprising Justices Ashwani Kumar Singh, Ashutosh Kumar and Birendra Kumar overruled the judgment by a division bench on September 23, 2010 in which the subordinate courts across Bihar had been directed to treat a girl as major if she is assessed to be aged between 16 to 17 years in medical examination and be allowed to go with the person of her choice in elopement cases.

While overruling the earlier judgement, the full bench also disposed of criminal writ petition of a minor girl urging that she be allowed to be set free from the aftercare home at Gai Ghat in Patna where she had been kept by the order of ACJM court, Motihari.

Her father had lodged an FIR with Govindganj police station in East Champaran on January 7 last year against one Dhanjeet Yadav and his family members alleging that they had kidnapped the girl. However, the girl after being recovered, recorded her statement before a judicial magistrate that she was loved Dhanjeet and married him after leaving her residence on her own.

The minor had also expressed her wish to go with Dhanjeet and said her family was hostile towards her and she had life threat from another person. She was later medically examined in which her age was ascertained to be between 16-17 years.

On January 25 last year, her father produced original documents in the court showing her date of birth as January 2, 2002. He sought his daughter’s custody pleading that she was a minor. The matter was adjourned at least five times till March 2 last year when the minor was produced before the ACJM court where she stated that she didn’t want to go to her parental house. The court ordered her to be kept at Gai Ghat until she becomes a major. Then the girl moved the high court and the division bench of then Chief Justice Amreshwar Pratap Sahi and Justice Ashutosh Kumar referred it to larger bench on September 23, 2019.

The 2010 judgment was in a case in which the girl was around 16 years of age and 34 weeks pregnant. She had told the court of a judicial magistrate that she had not been kidnapped but married one Mohammad Arif on her own will. However, she was also sent to Gai Ghat home by the CJM court in Katihar. She had challenged it before the high court, which ordered her release with an advisory to judicial magistrates in state that women in such cases be allowed to go with people of their choice.

Title: Three, including home guard shot at in Begusarai
Content:
Representative image

BEGUSARAI: Three persons, including a home guard jawan sustained gunshot injuries following exchange of fire between members of two rival groups over a contract for development of a bus stand to be awarded by the Begusarai Municipal Corporation under the Town police station area on Friday.

Municipal commissioner Abdul Hamid said the firing started ahead of opening of bids for development of the bus stand.

“Some motorbike-borne criminals stormed the municipal corporation office and soon engaged in physical altercation with a group of people waiting for the bids to be opened. Soon exchange of fire started resulting in gunshot injuries to three persons. Those injured included home guard jawan Ashok Yadav, Murari Singh and Babu Saheb of Ratanpur under the same police outpost,” Begusarai Town police station SHO Amrendra Kumar Jha said, adding that police were taking the help of the CCTV footage to ascertain the identity of the miscreants.

Police sources said that Babu Saheb is the son of one Ram Bharosh Singh, who is involved in several criminal cases. They also said that Ram Bharosh and Murari run rival gangs. All the injured have been admitted to various private hospitals for treatment.

Title: Man who stabbed two in Madhapar held
Content:
Rajkot: A man who had allegedly stabbed two youths , killing one of them in Madhapar village on the outskirts of Bhuj in Kutch district on Thursday evening, was nabbed on Friday.

Police said the accused, identified as Imran Sama, was nabbed from the outskirts of Makada village of Bhuj taluka.

Sama had stabbed Ramji Jogi and Ketan Jogi, both aged 25. Ramji died shortly after admission to G K General Hospital in Bhuj. Ketan survived with injuries.

In his statement, Ketan said he had a fight with Sama’s brother Mohsin. Nursing a grudge against Ketan, Sama picked up a fight with him when both met at the marriage function of a common friend’s sister.

Sama flashed out a knife and stabbed Ketan. When Ramji intervened, he, too, was stabbed.

Title: Cognizant’s bonus for staff among lowest in its history
Content:
Chennai: In a year when Cognizant’s corner office was occupied by a new CEO, the company announced that it will reward its employees with a bonus payment in the range of 35% to 95% of the promised sum, its lowest ever. For nearly 80% of its India-based employees the bonus is between 65% to 95%.

Cognizant follows a Jan-Dec fiscal year and Brian Humphries took over at the company’s CEO last April. Since then he has announced a massive restructuring of people and business with a stated objective to get growth back to the company and regain its bellwether status.

“This is the lowest ever I have received as bonus,” a senior Cognizant employee told TOI. “The average is just around 60%. The lower level employees get much less. Nobody received 100% bonus, this has never happened in the company.”

“Cognizant believes in a performance-based culture and has consistently shared the rewards of its growth with employees. In years of industry-leading growth, we paid significantly above the target. 2019 was a challenging year for us and our bonus payout is a reflection of that performance. We are a more focused, determined, and confident company now and all distractions of 2019 are behind us. We think we are doing the right things to return to historic levels of growth and once again make Cognizant the industry bellwether,” a Cognizant spokesperson told TOI.

During the year, the company had guided for revenue growth of 5.1%, but managed to achieve 5.2% in constant currency terms, at $16.8 billion. “

Speaking to analysts in a post earnings call, Humphries said the company would look to enter 2020 with a two-pronged strategy to expose Cognizant to faster-growing market categories.

“The first element is to protect and optimise our core business while scaling internationally. The second part is to invest to compete and win in four key digital battlegrounds: data, digital engineering, cloud and IoT,” he told analysts.

In an earlier interview to TOI, Humpries had said, “When I do see our associates, we do one-on-ones, but we also do town halls. After every one of those town halls, we get surveys, NPS (net promoter scores). And so, throughout the world, over the last 11 months, I have been tracking the NPS over town halls.

Simultaneously, of course, we look at our attrition rates as a company. Now in Q4 (December quarter), our attrition rate fell 3 percentage points from Q3. Q3 was 24, Q4 was 21. But more importantly, we are trying to drive a performance culture in Cognizant.”

Title: Scindia files RS nomination as BJP candidate; Congress fields Baraiya
Content:
Bhopal: Former Union minister, Jyotiraditya Scindia and two others filed their nominations for Rajya Sabha at the state assmbly here on Friday.

Scindia accompanied by senior BJP leaders reached the assembly secretariat in the afternoon and submitted his papers to the returning officer and Vidhan Sabha principal secretary, AP Singh. Elections for three seats of Rajya Sabha in Madhya Pradesh is slated for March 26.

After filing his nomination, Scindia tweeted, “Today I filed my nomination as a BJP candidate for Rajya Sabha seat along with senior party functionaries.” During nomination, former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, state BJP president V D Sharma, outgoing Rajya Sabha member Prabhat Jha, LoP Gopal Bhargava, Narottam Mishra and Yashodhara Raje were present among others at Vidhan Sabha.

Earlier in the day, Scindia, called on his aunt and BJP MLA, Yashodhara Raje at her official residence. Sources termed it as a family meeting. Later, he also met senior party leaders at the BJP's state head office and paid tributes to the party ideologue before filing the nomination.

The former Lok Sabha member from Guna, also had lunch at the residence of former minister and chief whip in the assembly, Narottam Mishra along with other party leaders. Mishra is believed to be the key man behind 'Operation Lotus'.

Scindia, who had arrived from New Delhi after joining the BJP in the presence of party president J P Nadda, was accorded a grand welcome at the BJP office here, on Thursday. After the function, Scindia attended a dinner hosted by Chouhan at his official residence. Two BJP candidates, Prof Sumer Singh Solanki from Barwani and former minister, Ranjana Baghel also filed Rajya Sabha nominations after Scindia, on Friday. Solanki's name was announced by the BJP leadership for Rajya Sabha candidature on Thursday.

Sources said that the party has fielded three candidates for three seats of Rajya Sabha though, one seat is likely to go to Congress candidate Digvijaya Singh. The three seats, currently held by Digvijaya Singh, and BJP leaders Prabhat Jha and Satyanarayan Jatiya, are falling vacant next month. The Congress has re-nominated Digvijaya Singh.

“A total of six candidates have filed nominations for three vacant seats,” said Awdhesh Pratap Singh, principal secretary of the assembly.

Apart from three candidates from BJP, two candidates from Congress, Phool Singh Baraiya and Digvijaya Singh have filed their papers. Baraiya was accompanied by senior Congress leader and former chief minister Digvijaya Singh, minister for cooperatives Dr Govind Singh and Rajya Sabha MP Rajmani Pat. The sixth candidate in the fray is Ram Das Dahiwale, an independent.

Title: Maha to ignore RBI note, shift funds to PSBs
Content:
Mumbai: A day after the RBI advisory to state governments to reconsider their decision to withdraw funds from private financial institutions, Maharashtra government ’s finance department, led by deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar , on Friday reiterated its earlier decision to not deposit funds in private banks.

“We have seen the RBI advisory. In view of the decision taken by the Cabinet a week ago, the finance department has issued an order on Wednesday. The department has directed all departments, corporations and civic bodies to not deposit their funds in the private financial institutions,’’ a top bureaucrat told TOI.

The official added that though the RBI has issued an advisory to the state chief secretary, it is advisory in nature and not mandatory. “As the Cabinet has taken the decision, it was decided not to take note of the RBI advisory,” he said.

In the wake of large-scale irregularities in Yes Bank , the state Cabinet directed all departments, corporations and civic organisations last week to not park funds in private banks and, instead, deposit them in nationalised banks.

“We found that many state departments and organisations had deposited huge amounts in private banks, including Yes Bank. Since there is no guarantee that the funds will remain safe with private lenders, the Cabinet took a decision to park them in nationalised banks,” the official said. “The RBI had pointed out that any apprehension on the safety of funds is misplaced and such a reactive decision will be against the stability of the private banks,” the official added.

Title: Sunday Mass at Raj Bhavan cancelled
Content: In a first in the state, Sunday Mass at the Raj Bhavan chapel has been cancelled in view of Covid-19 from March 15 until further notice. tnn

Title: Bihar's Bhojpur launches project on waste management
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: The Bhojpur district administration in collaboration with the Indian Institute of Technology- Patna (IIT-P) and Unicef as its knowledge partner, has launched a pilot project on domestic waste management in three panchayats having a population of around 20,000 households.

While liquid wastes will be cleaned by some aquatic plants to be developed on constructed wetlands, solid wastes will be shredded, bundled and sold to the agencies working under the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) in Patna. Money generated through the sale of wastes will be used for development work in the panchayats concerned.

“It is a pilot project designed to suit the rural areas and being based on technologies provided by IIT-P and the Unicef. It will serve multiple purposes of keeping the villages clean and generate re-chargeable resources of ground water,” Bhojpur DM Roshan Kushwaha said.

A two-day workshop on this project begun at the IIT-P on Friday, which was inaugurated by the principal secretary, rural development department Arvind Kumar Chaudhary, Bhojpur DM and several other officials of the district.

The Bhojpur DM said that initially the project has been launched in three panchayats—Dawan, Bampali and Nargada and the IIT-P team has already inspected the sites. “For liquid wastes treatment, all the small drains of a panchayat will be connected to a single large drain, which will empty its discharge on a specially constructed wetland,” said Kushwaha.

He added, “The water after microbial cleaning will be used for irrigation, fishery and other works. The project will come to ground in a month, after which other villages will be selected for the second phase of work.”

Unicef consultant on water, sanitation and hygiene Nikhil Kumar Singh said about 10 pollutant absorbing plants, including Canna Indica, Phragmites Australis, Glyceria Maxima and Baumea Articulata species for microbial cleaning have been selected for the purpose. “”The sewage water after treatment by these simple techniques will finally have the access to the existing water bodies like ponds and ditches for use in irrigation, fishery and other purposes,” he said.

Title: Lalu Prasad flayed for denying Rajya Sabha seat to LJD’s Sharad Yadav
Content:
Lalu Prasad

PATNA: While Loktantrik Janta Dal (LJD) chief Sharad Yadav on Friday refused to comment on RJD’s nomination for the Rajya Sabha, his party state vice-president Binu Yadav criticized RJD chief Lalu Prasad for betraying Sharad and even asked people not to vote for the party.

“He (Lalu) had betrayed an old socialist leader. It was Sharad Yadav who had parted ways with JD (U) for the sake of mandate of 11 crore people of Bihar and joined hands with Lalu Prasad. Now when time has come to send him to Rajya Sabha, Lalu sold the ticket to a rich businessman,” said Binu.

Playing the caste card, Binu said that the entire Yadav community had been cheated. “It is now clear that neither the Yadavs nor Muslims are with the RJD.
