Title: Baghpat boat tragedy: 9 more rescued, 2 women feared dead
Content:
Meerut: Nine more people were on Friday morning rescued by the NDRF divers while there was no trace of two women who were also on-board a ramshackle boat which capsized in Yamuna river in UP’s Baghpat district on Thursday night. The boat was carrying over 12 people, mostly women, when it capsized in Yamuna. The body of a 15 years old girl was fished out later, but the rescue operation was called off as darkness fell on late Thursday evening.

On Friday morning, when the operation resumed, the rescuers brought to safety another nine people who were stuck in the river. By Friday evening, the two missing women were feared dead. They were identified as Rajesh Devi and Moni Devi. The boat was returning from neighbouring Haryana.

“A 16-member NDRF team re-launched its search operation, but could not locate the two missing women. Meanwhile, the family of one dead, 15-year-old Nasreen, will be given Rs 4lakh as compensation. Out of nine saved by the divers, four have been discharged while five are still in hospital under observation. The injured will also be given monetary assistance of Rs 4,300,” said Shakuntala Gautam, district magistrate of Baghpat.

The NDRF team has arrived from Ghaziabad and is scanning the area in 5 km length.

Meanwhile, a hunt is on for the boat owner.

“It has come to our notice that the owner of the boat belongs to a village in Sonepat and teams have been sent to arrest him. Preliminary investigation has revealed that water had entered the boat after which it capsized. The depth of Yamuna is uneven and there is usually not much water at this time of year. But, because of continuous rains in the hills and western UP plains for the last couple of days, river had substantial water,” said SP Baghpat Gopender Yadav.

According to locals, ferrying of boat is an illegal activity, but is a common sight here. “Boats run on this stretch unhindered and are used to ferry villagers and farmers who have their crops on the other side. Besides, these boats also ferry illicit liquor,” said a local villager who did not wish to be quoted.

DM Shakuntala Gautam has also admitted there was no “contract or permission given by the administration to ferry boat in Yamuna.”

Title: Man held for duping people of Rs 1.72 cr in name of cooperative society
Content:
Pithoragarh: A person was arrested by Pithoragarh police on Friday on charges of opening a fake cooperative society and cheating customers of Rs 1.72 crore. Police officials told TOI that a probe has revealed involvement of a few other persons in the case and they will also be nabbed soon.

The arrest comes after a few local residents had lodged an FIR against accused Anand Singh Bhakuni on November 30, last year. According to police, 40-year-old Bhakuni is a native of Bisa village of Munsyari who was presently living in the Tildhukri locality of Pithoragarh. The complaint against Bhakuni alleges that he and his accomplices set up a fake enterprise by the name of “Arth Cooperative Society” and after collecting Rs 1.72 crore from people, they fled away.

Title: Woman kills husband over harassment
Content: Hyderabad: A woman burned her husband to death reportedly fed up of his harassment at their house in Bhadradri Kothagudem district on Thursday. The victim, Kalyan (32), succumbed while undergoing treatment at a local hospital in Khammam. Neighbours rushed to the house and doused the flames. A case was registered against Sailaja, who is in police custody. TNN

Title: Rs 2,000 crore plan to construct shorter Salem-Bengaluru road
Content: CHENNAI: Motorists from Salem and southern districts of Tamil Nadu can reach Hosur and Bengaluru faster once a Rs 2,061-crore plan to widen and shorten the Hosur-Dharmapuri section of national highway (NH) 844 is completed.Motorists can avoid Krishnagiri to reach Hosur or Bengaluru and the new route passing through Rajakottai and Palacode will be shorter by 25 km, said a NHAI official. The project would also boost economic activity in Rayakottai and Palacode, according to the NHAI officials.The NHAI had upgraded state highway 17 between Malur and Adhiyaman Kottai via Hosur as NH844 in March 2018 to increase efficiency of freight and passenger movement.The agency had now floated tenders for package II and III in Tamil Nadu and expedited land acquisition. The project would be taken up under the hybrid annuity mode (HAM), according to NHAI sources.While the first package would cover 23 km between Neraluru in Karnataka and Thorapalli Agraharam in Tamil Nadu, the second and third packages of the project — Thorapalli Agraharam to Jittandahalli, and Jittandahalli to Dharmapuri fall in Tamil Nadu.Nearly 550 hectares is required for the road project in TN. Of this, NHAI had completed declaration of land acquisition for 80% of the land, said a senior NHAI official. “We are identifying an agency to fix compensation for the land, which will be acquired for the project,” added the official.Once the road is converted into four-lane, it would give a relief to the regular commuters to Hosur and Bengaluru from Salem and beyond. “It will also bring down travel time to Hosur airport from Salem and neighbouring districts. They can take NH 844 and reach their destination quicker. Apart from skipping Krishnagiri and the long stretch, the proposed road will help the road users avoid Hosur town as it will be connected to the Satellite City Ring Road, which is under process,” added the official.Apart from this, four-laning of the 51-km stretch of the Chennai-Bengaluru National Highway 44 between Krishnagiri and Hosur will be taken up under the Bharatmala project. At present, 40,000 to 45,000 vehicles pass through the Krishnagiri-Hosur section of NH 44 and widening the road will ease congestion.

Title: Ahmedabad: Man held for raping stepdaughter
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Amraiwadi police on Thursday arrested a 38-year-old man for repeatedly raping his 11-year-old stepdaughter over a period of two years. In-charge inspector of Amraiwadi police station, M S Kotwal, said a case for rape and under the POCSO act has been registered.

“The accused was sent to judicial custody by the court on Friday evening and the victim was sent for medical examination,” Kotwal said. The girl’s mother filed the FIR.

According to the FIR, this was the girl’s mother’s second marriage. Her first had taken place in 2001. “She has two daughters from that marriage.

The victim, is 11 years and nine months old, and the child is 13 years old. The girls’ mother separated from their father in 2008,” a police official said.

Police sources said the girl’s mother went to live with her sister along with her children. She then got a job in a catering company. “There, she met Devendrasinh Rajput, now 38, who drove an autorickshaw and lived alone in the city. Rajput and the girl’s mother married in 2009. The woman, her new husband, and her two children went to Jaipur and then Haryana and lived there four years before returning to Gujarat,” said a police official. “She took a job at a factory while Rajput resumed driving an autorickshaw,” he added.

Stomach ache complaint alerted mother: According to the FIR, on March 11, the family went to bed at around 11pm. “The mother was worried as the girl complained of stomach ache. She got up at around 3.30am to check on the girl and found her husband not beside her. She then saw her husband lying over her daughter.

She asked him what he was doing, and he said he was looking at the girl’s face,” said a police official. “It was late in the night and she could not do anything alone. She called her mother, but the call went unanswered.

In the morning, she told her mother about what had happened. Her mother came to her house and questioned the girl in detail.

“The girl told them that her stepfather had been raping her for the past two years and had threatened her, saying he would kill her and her mother if she opened her mouth,” an investigator said.

The girl’s mother and maternal grandmother then approached police. “We wasted no time and registered a case of rape and POCSO and arrested the accused,” said Kotwal.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Farmer gored to death by bull in Shahjahanpur
Content:
Bareilly: A farmer was gored to death by a raging bull in Allahaganj area of Shahjahanpur district late on Thursday night.

According to police, Patiram (55), a resident of Koyla Gyanpur village, was keeping a watch of his crops when he was targeted by the bull and was grievously injured.

The family members then took him to a hospital where the doctors declared him brought dead. Family members have given an official complaint and demanded compensation.

SHO Allahaganj police station Sudhakar Pandey said, “We have sent the body for autopsy and the information has been shared with administrative officials. A survey will be done by the revenue department for sanctioning any compensation.”

Patiram is survived by his wife and seven children.

Title: After maths, Class X students stumped by social studies paper
Content:
Ahmedabad: Many students of Class X taking the board exams complained that they were puzzled by many questions in the social studies paper.

Sample this: Describe the art form in which characters like Rangalo and Rangali depicts the content through their peculiar style?

Another gem of a question with a black and white picture said the photo was of a popular food grain crop of India and students were asked to identify and write a descriptive note on it. Then there were others like “write a note on the temple in North Gujarat which has its carvings in Persian style” and “write a note on the monument which has found its place on the new five-hundred rupee note as a cultural heritage.” “My son knew the answer, but it was asked in such a twisted manner that he was confused. They could have directly asked students to describe the Red Fort instead of asking it in such a roundabout way,” said a parent. Another parent claimed that the trend of asking questions using photographs was a new one and the use of black and white photograph made it tougher.

On Friday, about 30 students were caught cheating in the Class X and Class XII board exams. Of these, 27 were Class X students. In Dahod, 14 cases of copying were registered for Class X social studies exams while three were registered in Junagadh and two in Vadodara, among others.

Title: Agri dept urges farmers to take up millet cultivation
Content:
Trichy: The agriculture department urged paddy farmers to switch to millet cultivation and earn good profits by adding value to their produce, here on Friday. The instruction came on the sidelines of a one-day seminar on ‘National food security mission (Nutri Cereals) 2019-2020,’ organized to persuad farmers to switch to millet cultivation.

“The central and state governments schemes are aimed at increasing the area of millets cultivation. Though our district reached the target area of 52,000 hectares for millet cultivation this year, farmers ti have the the awareness on millet cultivation,” said joint director of agriculture department, Trichy P Ashokan.

Experts from Tamil Nadu Agriculture University (TNAU) spoke about methods of millet cultivation in the event. The agriculture department asked the farmers to cultivate finger millet (Ragi or Kezhvaragu), little millet (Saamai), kodo millet (Varagu), foxtail millet (Thinai), barnyard millet (Kudhiraivaali) and proso millet (Pani Varagu).

Trichy agriculture deputy director S Shanthi said that the millet cultivation rquires one third of the water used for paddy. Taking into consideration their apprehension over marketing the produces, the agriculture marketing and agriculture business department helped the farmers with technical inputs to value added products from the millets.

“Value added products of the millets have its own share of market in the growing health conscious world. Millets added with values will fetch good income,” said JD Ashokan

C Gnanasambandan, head of central integrated pest management centre (CIPMC), advised the farmers to restrict the use of pesticides. Gnansambandhan said the millets can grow in rain-fed conditions and have lesser production cost. The chances of pest attacks and diseases are narrow.

Millets are cultivated in Dharmapuri, Krishnagiri, Salem (finger millet), Madurai and Virudhunagar (barnyard millet), Cuddalore and Villpuram (kodo millet), Vellore, Thiruvannamalai, Dharmapuri and Krishnagiri (little millet), Salem (foxtail millet and Proso millet).

Title: Don’t believe in rumours, Indian poultry products safe, says CARI
Content:
Representative image

BAREILLY: Don’t believe in rumours as all Indian poultry products are safe, said scientists at the country’s Central Avian Research Institute (CARI), dispelling fears among the people on whether consumption of chicken and eggs would transmit the deadly novel coronavirus (Covid-19) to humans. Fears and rumours have severely affected poultry industry across the country.

There have been widespread rumours and debates on poultry products in the country since the Covid-19 outbreak in China’s Hubei province last year. Acknowledging that livelihood of small and marginal farmers have suffered immensely due to such rumours, the scientists at CARI stated that poultry has not caused spread of virus anywhere.

On Friday, officiating director of Bareilly-based CARI, Sanjeev Kumar, told TOI, “Poultry are not found to be involved in transmission of Covid-19 to humans in any report across the globe so far.” While CARI’s principal scientist AS Yadav said, “No global institute has found any evidence that consuming poultry products will transmit Covid-19.”

Another CARI principal scientist, Sandeep Saran, said, “People should not believe in rumours as there is no connection between Covid-19 and poultry. Consumption of Indian poultry products is safe.”

Saran added, “People should maintain proper hygiene as a precautionary measure. The spread of rumours has affected poultry farmers as the sale of eggs and chicken has declined drastically. Farmers who are dependent on poultry farming are staring at a huge loss.”

CARI has been running a project development action plan for some people in UP , Saran said, adding that under the project, “we give chicks to contractual farmers for rearing. After birds are reared, we purchase them from farmers at market price and later sell it back in the market. We sold the last batch of broilers for Rs 75 per kg in the market but this time, there are hardly any takers even for Rs 43 per kg”.

Even joint secretary, ministry of fisheries, animal husbandry and dairying, OP Chaudhary, had issued a statement on March 5 stating that “the consumption of Indian poultry and poultry products, including eggs, is safe. A general hygiene, however, should be followed”.

Ghazi Khan who owns a poultry farm in Bareilly said, “A broiler chicken is currently priced at Rs 32-35 per kg in markets in Bareilly while its cost of production is Rs 75/ kg. For small farmers, the cost of production of broiler chicken can go as high as Rs 82-85 per kg. Though the cost of production of egg is Rs 3.80 per piece, it is currently being sold for Rs 2.80 per piece.”

Khan added, “Every year, the demand of chicken and eggs usually go up around Holi and poultry farmers make preparations of excess supply in advance. However, due to rumour-mongering, the demands of chicken and eggs have decreased. For instance, I usually supply 220 to 250 egg trays per day but following the spread of rumours, the sale has now decreased to 15-20 egg trays per day in the last fortnight. It has become difficult to pay salary to staff. Worst affected are small farmers who don’t have money to feed or vaccinate chicks.”

Title: BCA cancels awards ceremony but will hold AGM
Content:
Vadodara: The Baroda Cricket Association (BCA) is in a quandary over organizing its annual general meeting (AGM) that is slated to be held on March 19 owing to Coronavirus scare. However, it has announced postponement of its prize distribution ceremony that was to be held on Saturday evening. The ceremony was to felicitate cricketers who performed well in different tournaments.

But this action has left many people baffled looking at the numbers. The prize distribution ceremony had an attendee list of about 200, while the AGM is expecting at least 1,000 members to turn up and hasn’t been rescheduled yet.

“We have issued a legal notice for the AGM so we are not sure if we can postpone it without proper legal advice. As of now, we are going to organize the AGM. We are also waiting for clear directives from the state government in regards to Coronavirus,” said Satyajit Gaekwad, chairman, BCA press and publicity committee.

The association wants to hold its pending AGMs of 2015-16, 2016-17, 2017-18 and 2018-19 on March 19 as it would pave the way for BCA to get Rs 100 crore grant from the BCCI. BCA officials said that they are closely monitoring the Coronavirus situation and they will take a call on the AGM after legal consultation.

Title: Karur police recover seven stolen panchaloha idols, gold ornaments
Content:
Trichy: Karur town police have recovered seven panchaloha idols of Hindu deities from an isolated location in the district along with jewellery weighing 35 sovereigns stolen from a house in the town last month. Among the idols were those of Perumal, Sridevi and Boomadevi apart from Ram, Shiva and Hanuman.

While there is no clue about the temple from where these idols were stolen, Karur town police have handed them over to the Karur district court. They have also written to the idol wing police on the recovery of the idols. As for the jewellery found, it was On February 5 that Madhumitha of Vadivel Nagar reported the theft of 54 sovereigns of ornaments from her house to the Karur town police.

The special team formed to nab the perpetrators scanned the CCTV footage and active mobile numbers at the scene of the crime. The footage revealed involvement of a gang which came in a car in the theft incident. While the police were unable to track down the perpetrators for a month, a breakthrough came in the form of S Rathina Kumar from Kulithalai of Karur district who was detained by police on suspicion during a routine vehicle check in Karur.

He confessed to have orchestrated the theft along with three others identified as P Karuppasamy alias Sivabalan from Madurai, P Mohanraj from Tiruchengode and Boopathi Prabakaran. “We came to know that the main accused Karuppasamy died on February 16 over ill health,” said inspector K Udaya Kumar of Karur town police station.

Rathina Kumar took them to a spot at Vadipatti in Madurai district along the Dindigul - Madurai road from where the 35 sovereigns of stolen jewellery were recovered. Besides, seven panchaloha idols stolen by Karuppasamy on an earlier occasion were also recovered from an adjacent spot, he said. While Rathina Kumar doesn’t seem to have been involved in the theft of idols, there is no clarity on the temple to which the idols belong, added Udayakumar. One of the accused in the theft, Mohan Raj is in Salem jail in connection with a different case. The special team is searching for Prabakaran who is absconding.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Widow killed by brothers over interfaith affair, body cremated surreptitiously
Content:
Representatuve Image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: A 35-year-old woman was strangled to death allegedly by her two brothers who were opposed against her plans to marry a man from a different religion in Muzaffarnagar district . The accused also cremated the woman’s body clandestinely to evade police action. But, the woman’s friend approached police after which an FIR was registered and the two brothers were arrested and sent to jail. According to police sources, Sadhana, a resident of Kukda village in Muzaffarnagar, got married to a Delhi resident a few years ago. But, her husband died and she returned to live at her parents’ village.

“She had an affair with a man of the village and they had plans to get married,” a police officer said. But, her brothers were against the plan. They strangled Sadhana to death on the night of March 11-12 and cremated the body without informing police, the complaint alleged.

“The brothers, Sonu and Sumit, have been booked for murder. The case was filed at New-Mandi police station on Thursday. They were produced before a local court and sent to jail,” said Deepak Chaturvedi, station house officer.

Title: 4,000 Tamil Nadu schools to get CCTV cameras, says CM Edappadi K Palaniswami
Content:
Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami

CHENNAI: In all, 4,282 high and higher secondary schools in the state will soon get CCTV cameras, said chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Friday. The cameras will be installed at a cost of Rs 48.73 crore.

In the first phase, the government has already begun installing surveillance cameras across 1,890 schools, said the chief minister while making a suo motu statement in the assembly on Friday.

The announcement was widely lauded by educators in government schools.

The government high school, Kavangarai is among schools which will get surveillance cameras. The school has more than 700 students and only 20 teachers. Its principal S Thenmozhi said cameras would help step up safety and security on their campus. “Many people come to the school to deliver lunch boxes or for some other work. Teachers do their best and keep a vigil when children come to school or leave. But, there is only so much we can do. Once, cameras are installed we will be more relaxed,” she said.

The chief minister made a slew of other announcements for higher education and schools. A sum of Rs 210 crore has been allocated to six universities to conduct research. Research on electric vehicle technology will be held in Anna University, sanitary and environment research in Annamalai university, hygiene, and skills in Bharathidasan University, cancer research at Bharathiar University, biomedical research at Madurai Kamaraj University and research on biomedical usage at Madras university. Each institution has been allocated a sum of Rs 35 crore for the purpose.

The government has allocated Rs 150 crore for constructing additional buildings, research labs and providing other equipment for postgraduate courses offered in government arts and science colleges, due to increasing admissions. In all, Rs 10 crore have been allotted to renovate the 164-year-old Institute of Advanced Study in Education, Saidapet, another Rs 10 crore has been sanctioned for renovation of the principals’ residence and other buildings of Presidency College. Again, Rs 16.6 crore is allocated to provide stipend to 10,000 engineering and polytechnic students.

The subsidy to renovate and maintain classrooms and school buildings have been increased from Rs 38.5 crore to Rs 100 crore for the academic year 2020-21. Twenty-five new government primary schools will be set up at a project cost of Rs 5.72 crore. Ten primary schools will be upgraded to middle schools, 15 middle schools to high schools and 30 high schools to higher secondary schools.

Title: 3 including child protection officer caught
Content:
Vadodara: The anti-corruption bureau (ACB) on Friday arrested three persons including Chhota Udepur district child protection officer for accepting a bribe of Rs 10,000.

According to ACB sleuths, the district child protection unit in Chhota Udepur had learnt that a contractor had hired two child labourers for his work and demanded the money as hush-up fee.

Balbhadra Gadhvi, child protection officer and Yatin Patil, another officer in the unit called the contractor to his office and warned him of action against him. When the contractor pleaded for mercy, the duo sought Rs 20,000 as bribe to spare him. The contractor paid them Rs 10,000, but when the duo sought the remaining amount, he approached the ACB office in Vadodara. The ACB laid a trap on Friday in Chhota Udepur district Seva Sadan and caught Gadhvi’s driver, Karamsinh Rathwa, who was sent by the duo to collect the money on their behalf from the contractor.

Title: FIR filed over woman’s morphed photos uploaded on social media
Content:
Ahmedabad: A 27-year-old man lodged a complaint at Khokhra police station on Friday about morphed obscene photos of his 25-year-old wife circulated on social media from two Instagram accounts.

Inspector B Z Jhala of Khokhra police station said they will write to Instagram for the IP log address of the device from which the two Instagram accounts were made and operated. “We have lodged a case under Section 354 (d) of IPC and sections of the IT act. The service provider takes about a week to send the IP log address, and we can locate the accused after that. We are taking help of the city cybercrime cell also to catch the accused,” inspector Jhala said.

“On March 11, at about 3.30pm some unknown person sent a message to his wife with her morphed photos and threatened to make them viral on social media,” said a police source. Her husband then submitted an application in city cybercrime cell which was later transferred to Khokhra police and converted into an FIR. tnn

Title: Coronavirus dampens Rangpanchami celebrations, Kolhapuri residents prefer to stay indoors
Content: KOLHAPUR: The fear of coronavirus outbreak witnessed a subdued celebration of Rangpanchami on Friday.There was a decent crowd moving out on the streets as no official programmes were arranged to celebrate the festival of colours. The civic health administration had earlier advised the citizens not to gather in large numbers and avoid contact with the persons having travel history lately or flu-like symptoms.Youths were seen enjoying at some places in the morning hours. The police were deployed at several schools and colleges to keep watch on the celebrations. The citizens mostly resorted to using dry colours and avoided much use of water.Despite the advice, in some places the rain dance programmes were organised, which were far and few as compared to last year. The vendors selling colours were seen waiting till afternoon for the buyers, unlike earlier years when the colours were in shortage due to high demand.A seller from Bajar Gate at KMC Building said that this time he witnessed less enthusiasm to celebrate the festival. The vendor had stocked the environment-friendly non-chemical colours, however there were no buyers this time around. “The Rangpanchami this year is not subdued. People are not coming out of their homes to celebrate. We are visiting our friends and relatives to apply colour. The fear of coronavirus is clearly seen on the celebrations,” said Prathamesh Solanki , resident of Nagala Park.Interestingly, the people avoided applying colours to strangers in the wake of the outbreak. Many covered their mouth and nose with masks while leaving out to celebrate the festival. “It is for precaution measure to avoid the infection, as well as to stop colours from entering mouth and nose,” said a resident.KMC halts football matchesAfter the directions from the state government, the KMC has decided to cancel all football matches from Friday onwards. The KMC had earlier arranged football tournament which was scheduled to conclude on March 15. Thousands had witnessed the earlier round of the matches.

Title: Waterlogging due to rainfall throws traffic out of gear in Doon
Content:
Dehradun: The rain spell that lashed the city on Friday not only slowed down the pace of traffic in the city but also caused water logging in areas like New Road, Darsanlal Chowk, Buddha Chowk, and Miyawala.

This caused inconvenience for both motorists and pedestrians.

Vandana Kanyal, a resident of EC Road, told TOI, “I had gone to Buddha Chowk with my daughter for some important work but we had a tough time treading on waterlogged streets.”

Traffic cops struggled to maintain smooth flow of traffic across the city as more and more people took out their cars to avoid getting drenched.

Arun Chamoli, a resident of Rajpur Road, said, “I went out shopping on Friday but the volume of traffic was much more than my expectation. Waterlogging on roadside made it difficult for me to move out of the car.”

Miyawala area was among the worst hit as rainwater filled pot holes on the road and in absence of a proper drainage facility, locals had to struggle to even get out of their homes.

TOI had earlier reported the lack of sanitation facilities and the water logging issue faced by residents of Vanaspati Puram society in Miyawala locality.

Meanwhile, Jagmohan Chauhan, executive engineer at Public Works Department, Dehradun , told TOI, “The problem of waterlogging in certain areas is due to some ongoing maintenance works. Once the works are completed, the situation will improve.”

Title: Lakshya Sen knocked out of All England Badminton Championship
Content:
Dehradun: Uttarakhand badminton star Lakshya Sen got knocked out of the second round of the men’s singles category at the All England Badminton Championship in Birmingham on Thursday. Sen (world ranking 29) lost straight sets to Denmark’s Viktor Axelsen (world ranking 7) by 21-17 and 21-18

Sen was the only player from the Indian contingent to have advanced to the second round of the men’s singles event. The Almora-born shuttler had defeated Hong Kong’s Lee Cheuk Yiu by 17-21, 21-8 and 21-17 in his first round match.

It is worth mentioning that Sen’s performance in the upcoming international tournaments will decide if he will qualify for the Tokyo Olympics 2020 or not. However, some of the upcoming badminton events are likely to get cancelled in view of the Coronavirus scare.

Title: Chainsnatcher who jumped parole held after five years
Content:
Vadodara: Five years after he jumped parole and remained underground, the detection of crime branch (DCB) on Friday finally caught up with the 44-year-old criminal Kishor Maachi, a resident of Kishanwadi, who has 35 cases of chain snatching filed against him.

Cops nabbed Maachi on basis of a tip off and will now hand him over to the police stations where the offences have been registered against him.

According to cops, Maachi snatched 35 chains in different cities of Gujarat even while evading arrest. “Maachi was jailed on charges of committing nearly a dozen-odd chain-snatching in Vadodara, Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar and Anand. He got parole in 2015 following which he went missing,” said Jaydeepsinh Jadeja, DCP (crime).

The police have recovered seven gold chains worth Rs 4.28 lakh, a two-wheeler and two mobile phones from him. “Maachiwas a casual labourer and used to operate alone. He targeted women in isolated areas in different cities and then disappear for a few days,” the police said and added that he may have committed other crimes too.

The police said that the accused, who originally hails from Navsari, employed a modus operandi of changing his location frequently. “He used to visit a city for a day and target a few victims there. After snatching the gold chains, he would leave the city immediately making it difficult for cops to identify him,” Jadeja told TOI.

The police said that Maachi admitted to have one chain snatching in Godhra, five in Bharuch, two in Navsari, one in Surat, four in Valsad, three in Idar, one in Mehsana, one in Himmatnagar, one in Unjha, one in Patan, three in Siddhpur, two in Palanpur, one in Deesa, one in Surendranagar and one in Borsad. “Apart from this, seven other offences of chain snatchings were registered against him at Nadiad, Godhra, Patan, Palanpur, Himmatnagar and Mehsana,” Jadeja added.

Title: 2 admitted to RIMS in Kadapa
Content: Two persons who returned from abroad and were displaying symptoms of COVID-19 were admitted to the coronavirus isolation ward at Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences ( RIMS ) in Kadapa on Friday.A woman from Kadapa returned from Mecca a few days ago. After her return, she developed a cold, cough and fever. Her family had her admitted to the isolation ward at RIMS on Friday.A middle-aged man who returned from the Gulf a few days ago, displayed coronavirus symptoms and was rushed to the isolation ward at RIMS.Doctors at the hospital collected samples of both patients. The samples have been sent for examination. TNN

Title: Army recruitment drive in 6 UP districts postponed amid Covid-19 fear
Content:
Agra: The Indian Army has postponed its proposed recruitment drive in Mathura as a precautionary measure to stop the spread of coronavirus, which has claimed one life in India so far. The 21-day drive was to start on March 17 in six districts of Agra, Mathura, Aligarh, Hathras, Kasganj and Firozabad.

Talking to TOI, director-recruitment Col Abhay Singh said this drive was scheduled to recruit soldiers till April 6 and over 1 lakh registrations had been done for the same. He said that next date will be finalised after observing the situation.

According to reports, the Army has cancelled all its recruitment drives for a period of one month. It has also advised all its personnel to restrict travel, except for essential duties. The Army has instructed all Command HQs to establish quarantine facilities. Till now, the Army has already established 300-bed quarantine facility in Manesar, 1000-bed each in Jodhpur, Jaisalmer and Jhansi. It also said that a 300-bed each quarantine facility was established in Binnaguri in West Bengal and in Bihar's Gaya.

Meanwhile, the three-day Agra Taj Car rally, scheduled from March 27, had also been cancelled. This decision was taken as a precautionary measure due to spread of coronavirus, said president of Motor Sports Club of Agra Rajiv Gupta.

Title: 28 people killed as rain, lightning, hailstorm lash parts of UP
Content:
Bareilly/Rampur/ Muzaffarnagar/ Bijnor: Twenty-eight people were killed as heavy rain, accompanied by hailstorm and lightning , lashed several parts of Uttar Pradesh on Thursday and Friday, causing severe damage to crops. Chief minister Yogi Adityanath has announced compensation of Rs 4 lakh for the kin of the victims.

According to UP officials, one person each died in Varanasi, Gorakhpur, Siddharthnagar, Ayodhya, Chandauli, Kanpur Dehat , Mirzapur and Balrampur, whereas three people each were killed in Jaunpur and Barabanki, two people died in Sonbhadra and six each in Sitapur and Lakhmipur Kheri.

In Kheri, a farmer from Sikandrabad village, was struck by lightning when he was working in his field. And Lal Mohammed (8) died after an electric pole fell on him in Dudhwa Midania village of Phoolbehad area of the district.

Apart from that, two houses were damaged due to lightning while trees fell on three houses in Kheri district. All the victims have sought compensation from district administration for their losses.

Three cattle were also killed by lightning and power supply in many rural areas was disturbed as trees fell on the electric lines.

Speaking to TOI, district magistrate Kheri Shailandra Singh said, “We are assessing the losses suffered by the farmers and family members of the people who have lost their lives. We will make sure that they are awarded compensation at the earliest. SDM and district agriculture officer have been advised to ensure that relief is provided to every victim.”

Meanwhile, the incessant rain also caused widespread damage to crops. Wheat, mustard, maize, peas, potato and cauliflower damaged due to hailstorm. Among the districts that were affected due to hailstorm include Muzaffarnagar, Bijnor and Rampur.

A Muzaffarnagar-based farmer, Babli Sharma, said, "Mustard crop has been completely destroyed due to hailstorm and rain. We want the government to come forward with a compensation soon.”

In Rampur, farmers protested before the officials in Bilaspur and Swar tehsils and demanded compensation.

Speaking with TOI, Rampur district magistrate Aunjaneya Kumar Singh said, “The real assessment of crops and vegetables in the affected areas has been accessed and the officials of the insurance companies have been directed in the matter. My department is making a report from the affected areas in the entire district. I have assured the farmers' delegation that no affected farmer will be left unattended.”

In Bijnor, however, farmers complained that the agriculture department did not carry out any survey to assess the damage of crops. The district recorded 13.8mm rain on Friday.

Deputy director of agriculture, Bijnor, JP Chaudhary said, “It is difficult for us to assess the real damage caused to the standing wheat crop. I have instructed the officials to go to the fields and get accurate information.”

Not only wheat farmers, but mango cultivators also suffered huge losses.

Talking to TOI, district horticulture officer, Narpal Malik said, “The losses are yet to be assessed. Rain and hailstorm damaged mango trees in some pockets of the district.”

A mango cultivator, Sultan Ahmed, claimed, “We were expecting a bumper mango production this time. But, poor weather conditions have dashed our hope. If gusty winds continue, we might incur more losses. The mango orchards are spread here in around 13,000-hectare area.”

According to official sources in Bijnor, only 1,400 out of over 4 lakh farmers have been compensated under the PM Fasal Bima Yojana.

Title: PWD promises to release water to save banana crops
Content:
Trichy: Bowing to pressure from banana farmers along the Uyyakondan canal stretch, the river conservancy (RC) division of the public works department (PWD) on Friday assured to release water to the canal from Mayanur barrage across Cauvery to save the wilting banana plantation.

A group of 60 farmers under the banner of Tamil Nadu Banana Producers Association, Trichy district staged a sit-in protest on the campus of the office of the RC division near Trichy district court on Friday morning.

They demanded the PWD to release water from the barrage so that their seven-month-old banana crop in around 10,000 acres in Pettavaithalai, Perugamani, Sirugamani, Analai, Thirupparaithurai, Kodiyalam, Puliyur, Kuzhumani, Ettarai, Koppu, Mullikarumbur, Vayalur, Adhavathur and Somarasampettai areas, which are under threat due to lack of water, are benefited.

“Uyyakondan canal is the lifeline for banana crops in the area. The canal has not seen water for nearly one month. The crops are now wilting. Timely release of water will save the crops and preventing the farmers from incurring a huge loss,” said district secretary of Tamilaga Vivasayigal Sangam affiliated to the CPI, Ayilai Sivasuiyan.

Aggrieved farmers said the RC division has stored certain quantity of water in the barrage during the recent release of water from Mettur dam.

The farmers stressed that the release of water will not only infuse fresh blood to the banana crops but also recharge the declining ground water level. Executive engineer of PWD, RC division Baskar called the protesting farmers for a meeting and assured to release the water in a couple of days. “The water can be released by Monday. It is now supplied to some other area. Once released, it could bring down the crisis to some extent,” said Baskar.

Title: TDP leaders on defection spree, party hit in 3 dists
Content:
Hyderabad: With defections from the main opposition TDP to the ruling YSR Congress continuing unabated in Andhra Pradesh, there has been a significant change in the political scenario of Kadapa, Kurnool and Prakasam districts. Four former ministers and five former MLAs recently quit the TDP and Jana Sena, respectively, and joined YSRC.

In Kadapa, the home turf of AP chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy, former minister P Rama Subba Reddy resigned from the TDP and joined YSRC. Another political leader, Adinarayana Reddy, who was with TDP, joined the BJP. The steady wave of defections from TDP to YSRC is also evident from the shifting of loyalties by ex-MLCs Dokka Manikya Varaprasad and KE Prabhakar, ex-MLAs Kadiri Babu Rao, Rehman and T Vijay Kumar, K Balaram and his son Venkatesh. Apart from these names, former MLC Satish Reddy, who had contested against Jaganmohan, quit the TDP and is expected to join the YSRC.

Political analyst Prof. K Nageshwar told TOI, “YSR Congress was against defections. Only thing is it took the moral high ground that if any sitting MLA or MP wants to join YSRC they have to resign and contest the elections again,” he said. He added that 23 MLAs of YSRC had defected to the TDP when TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu was the CM. “Jagan was criticising him for the defections then, and he doesn’t want TDP to criticise him now. Defections are continuing due to polls. They are engineered to demoralise TDP ahead of polls,” he said.

Prof. Nageshwar opined that when the three-capital decision was taken by the AP government, three TDP MLAs had revolted against their own party. “YSRC wants to send a message that even TDP MLAs are in favour of the decision,” he alleged.

Meanwhile, the TDP took to social media to post old and new clippings of Jagan speaking on defections. Senior YSRC leader S Ramakrishna Reddy told TOI, “All politicians joining the party are doing so of their own volition. We are not making any efforts to get them in. All of them are ex-ministers and ex-MLAs, so where is the question of defections.”

Title: Case against teacher for sexually harassing girls
Content:
Nagappattinam: The all women police in Mayiladuthurai has registered a case against a 57-year-old government school teacher after a group of girl students filed a complaint alleging sexual harassment.

Police booked Narayana Prasad of a government high school near Mayiladuthurai in Nagappattinam district. He was accused of sexually harassing around 15 girl students of the school for the past few months.

The crime came to light after one of the students brought the issue to the notice of her parents who took it up with the headmaster of the school. The school education department carried out inquires with the girls.

Inquiry revealed that the teacher had even threatened to reduce the marks in their practical exams if they exposed him.

Title: KMC to spend Rs 57 crore for upgrading civic schools in Kolhapur
Content:
Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The Kolhapur Municipal Corporation ( KMC ) is going to spend Rs 57.75 crore during 2020-21 to develop the civic-run schools on a par with the private institutes.

Over 9,000 students are studying in 59 civic-run schools. In the recent years, the efforts by the teachers have paid off and many students from these schools have qualified the talent search and competitive exams. The corporators and local activists have taken keen interest in developing some schools, which have waiting for months for the admissions.

The KMC provides schooling to the students by charging parents minimal fees, provides the books and the school dress as well. The demand for starting the classes to impart education in semi-English medium is growing. In last couple of years, 17 schools have started semi-English medium classes up to eight standard. In the current year, five such classes will be opened in other schools as well.

KMC’s education officer Shankar Yadav said, “We are expecting Rs 37 crore from the KMC funds and the remaining from the state government grants. We are going to develop schools through corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds. The digital-learning facilities will be provided through CSR funds. The computers, projectors and advanced digital teaching aids will be provided to the schools. The teachers will be trained to handle the advanced technology.”

The KMC is going to hand over 58 abandoned buildings to the education board to start the classes and develop the infrastructure. Yadav said that the Paschim Maharashtra Devasthan Samiti (PMDS), which manages Mahalaxmi temple, is also going to provide funds develop the schooling infrastructure. The facilities will be developed for sports and sanitation.

“We are also focusing on improving the quality of education and the learning ability of the students. Separate coaching for the students to excel in the talent search exams will be started and the mock-tests will be conducted, especially for the fifth standard students, appearing for the scholarship exams. We have seen increase in the students attending the schools and the drop-out rate has declined significantly,” said Yadav.

Title: Youth, 22, succumbs to gun shot fired by ex- BJYM leader
Content:
Agra: A 22-year-old youth, who was shot at and seriously injured allegedly by former Bharatiya Janta Yuva Morcha (BJYM) office bearer Vinay Varshney during a clash in Aligarh’s Babri Mandi area last month, succumbed to his injuries on Friday. Mohammad Tariq was injured during a clash that broke out between anti-CAA protesters and police on February 23.

Though police claimed that Tariq died on Friday, his relatives alleged that he had died on Wednesday, the day Varshney was arrested in connection with the alleged attempt to his murder.

They alleged that police hid his death for two days.

A day earlier, Aligarh administration had announced Rs 3 lakh compensation to Tariq’a family members, saying that his “treatment was very expensive”.

Officials had claimed on Thursday that his condition was stable. They had revealed that Tariq’s lower part of the body was paralysed and he had suffered brain hemorrhage.

According to the FIR, Tariq was standing on the balcony of his house, when he was struck by a bullet. He was admitted in a critical condition at the JN Medical College. According to his brother, Shariq, Tariq had received a gunshot wound in his stomach and he was admitted in the ICU. He claimed that he was not allowed to meet him for the past few days.

Title: Heavy rain, hailstorm lash Dehradun, hills receive snowfall; several roads blocked
Content:
A couple of children use plastic sheets to shield themselves from the rain in Dehradun

Dehradun: A fresh spell of heavy rainfall and a bout of hailstorm lashed Dehradun and several other parts of Uttarakhand on Friday.

High altitude places, including Char Dham cities and surrounding places, received snowfall in past 24 hours.

According to the regional meteorological centre, rainfall accompanied by hail and thunder squall lashed Pithoragarh, Dehradun, Haridwar, Nainital, and Udham Singh Nagar districts.

Dehradun received 16.8 mm rainfall, while New Tehri was lashed by 13.6 mm rainfall and Mussoorie received 12.5mm rainfall.

“Several places received incessant rainfall, hail and thunder squall on Thursday and Friday. Higher reaches also received snowfall. The thunder activity is likely to continue on Friday night and Saturday as well,” said Bikram Singh, director of regional meteorological centre.

Incessant rain and snowfall since Wednesday have disrupted road connectivity and other basic facilities in Uttarkashi district. Several major roads, including Gangotri and Yamunotri national highways, got blocked due to a thick blanket of snow and landslide triggered by heavy rains. Bad weather conditions also hit drinking water and power supply in several areas of the district causing inconvenience for local people.

Meanwhile, restoration works were started to bring respite for locals of the affected areas. Devendra Patwal, district disaster management officer, told TOI, “Border Road Organisation (BRO) has restored Gangotri highway till Dharali village and the National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) has cleared the Yamunotri highway at Damta and Kuthnor regions. Electricity department has also restored power supply in Bhramkhal region. We will restore other facilities in remaining areas by Friday late evening.”

Title: Sastra to set up STEM labs in 10 TN schools
Content:
Trichy: SASTRA Deemed University, Thanjavur, has selected 10 schools in Tamil Nadu to set up SASTRA-CNR Rao laboratories. Named after Indian chemist C N R Rao, the Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) lab is aimed at strengthening science and technology-based learning at the school level.

Each of the 10 schools will get a lab worth Rs 5 lakh. These labs will have Do-It-Yourself (DIY) kits on robotics, Internet of Things (IoT), 3D printing, artificial intelligence (AI) and drones.

SASTRA had called for competitive proposal submission from schools across Tamil Nadu. More than a hundred schools submitted their proposals from which 25 schools were shortlisted for interaction and presentation.

The schools are, Adhyapana School (Madurai), Swami Dayananda School (Manjakudi), Chinmaya Vidyalaya Matriculation (Trichy), Government Model Girls Higher Secondary School (Manachanallur), Sri Matha Matriculation Higher Secondary School (Kumbakonam), PSBB (Chennai), Akshaya Academy (Coimbatore), PS Senior Secondary School (Chennai), Gurukulam Matriculation (Chengalpet) and Sitadevi Garodia Hindu Vidyalaya, (Chengalpet).

Schools have been selected from rural and urban areas based on the requirement and interest level of the teachers and management to utilize the new laboratory to the students from Classes VI to XII. While a few schools opted to use this lab up to Class IX by adopting this during the working hours others opted it as special course. tnn

Title: Forest dept makes WhatsApp group for receiving fire alerts
Content:
Trichy: The forest department has created a Whatsapp group including volunteers from villages close to the reserve forest areas to get timely alerts in case of a forest fire. The department has also enforced controlled burning near the fire line to prevent any forest fire, following a couple of fire incidents near the forest in the last few days.

The Whatsapp group which has around 40 staffers from the forest department and 110 volunteers from the village forest committee.

“These committees have members from fringe villages close to the forest. Young volunteers from these villages have been added to the Whatsapp group, who have been sensitised on passing on alerts in case of a forest fire,” said Trichy district forest officer D Sujatha.

Speaking on the preparedness, she said contact numbers of forest guards are registered with the forest survey of India for receiving fire alert SMS. “To ensure that we receive alert in a prompt manner, the Whatsapp group has been created this year with volunteers,” she said.

On witnessing fire in a few places like Nedungur and Veeramachanpatti in Trichy forest range over the last few days, Sujatha said they were man-made. “However, the fact remains that these places have become prone to fires. Therefore, necessary preventive measures have been taken,” she said.

“In most of the forest fire in Trichy, the fire spreads from agriculture lands to adjoining forest areas. Since farmers set their land on fire after harvest, we have been sensitising them on refraining from such activities,” she said.

Title: Will cut water supply if dues not paid, Jal Sansthan to Cantt board
Content:
Agra: Agra Jal Sansthan has issued a notice to the Agra Cantonment Board for failing to clear water supply dues. The Jal Sansthan has warned the cantonment board that if Rs 3.19 crore is not paid within one week, the water supply in the area will be stopped.

The Cantt board mainly caters to a civilian area spanning 952.55 hectares like Naulakha, Shahzadi Mandi, Sultanpura, Lalkurti, Pratappura, Nai Basti and Sadar Bazaar. The area has a population of over one lakh and is administered by the board for civic and developmental functions.

The Jal Santhan supplies 2.5 million litres per day (MLD) treated Ganga water to Agra Cantonment Board areas.

In the letter sent to the vice-president of the Cantt board, secretary of the Agra Jal Sansthan Anwar Khwaja said due to non-payment of the outstanding dues, they were facing difficulties in paying salaries to its workers.

Besides, the stopping water supply, Khwaja also warned of legal action in case the Cantt board fails to clear the outstanding dues.

Jal Sansthan secretary said, “Since June 28, 2019, we have issued 11 reminders to the Cantt board for payment of water bill. But no response ha sbeen received. Now, we have issued the final notice, asking for payment of Rs 3,19,46,112 in one week otherwise the water supply will be stopped.”

Title: Vadodara airport ranked 2nd cleanest in India
Content:
Vadodara airport witnessed 1.2 million per annum passenger movement.

VADODARA: Vadodara airport has been adjudged second cleanest and safest airport in the country in the category of airports having passenger handling capacity up to 1.5 million.

A total of 52 airports in the country fall under this category III.

Udaipur airport has been judged best in this category followed by Vadodara and Vijaywada.

“An Airports Authority of India (AAI) survey team had inspected nearly 32 parameters covering all operational aspects of the airport, including the air traffic control, runway and terminal building a couple of months ago, before declaring the survey results,” said Vadodara airport director Charan Singh.

Singh will be receiving the award from civil aviation minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Saturday at Wings 2020 at Hyderabad.

Vadodara airport witnessed 1.2 million per annum passenger movement while there are 13 arrivals and 13 departures of flights daily with air connectivity to Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Bangalore.

From March 29, the airport will get fresh connectivity to Indore and Kolkata.

Title: With 8 Covid-19 cases, Agra hoteliers, businessmen say virus will surely bankrupt them, if not kill
Content: AGRA: With markets crashing across the globe and countries imposing travel restrictions due to the coronavirus pandemic, hoteliers and industrials in the Taj city are witnessing a huge decline in business. Some of them fear the virus may not kill them but would surely bankrupt them if the downward trend continues for a few more weeks. The impact of the slowdown may even hit employees as both hoteliers and industrialists are looking at ways and means to cut their expenses, including retrenchments.Of the total 12 Covid-19 positive cases in Uttar Pradesh, Agra alone has reported eight, making it one of the deadliest cities in the country.Hotels in Agra wore a deserted look with cancellations rising to nearly 50%. Besides, shoe exporters, some of whom tested positive for Covid-19 following their visit to a recent leather trade fair in Italy, are looking at cancellation of orders with several countries closing their borders.Tourism Guild of Agra vice-president Rajiv Saxena said that the industry is “witnessing nearly 40-50% cancellations and this is only going to increase further as more restrictions are announced by governments across the globe”. With markets crashing and tourists demanding refunds, it is a double whammy for the tourism industry, he said.Agra’s Jaypee Palace Hotel vice-president Hari Sukumar said, “Due to continued visa restrictions and travel ban, we are looking at an early onset of the sluggish summer season here as far as travel and tourism is concerned.” He added that even domestic tourists are scared to travel due to coronavirus scare . “Tough days are ahead. I hope that the climate will bring things back to normal and we can all get back to being busy again,” he said.The hotel alone received requests for cancellation of bookings for 800 rooms in a week.Clarks Shiraz chief operating officer Debashish Bhowmik agreed that it’s a bad time for hoteliers. “Every year, around 600 rooms are booked by Chinese tourists after the Chinese new year starts. This year, it started on January 25 and not a single room was booked by them due to Covid-19. Besides, domestic tourists stopped travelling too due to panic across the nation. We have estimated a 50-60% drop in the business in the next two months as compared to last year,” Bhowmik said, adding that he has seen 30% loss in the business since January.Agra Footwear Manufacturers and Exporters Chamber (AFMEC) president Puran Davar said visa restrictions, uncertainty and panic across the world will “impact the shoe industry hugely as our main buyers are mainly from Central Europe including Italy, Germany and France”.Shoe exporter Gopal Goyal said, “The entire leather industry has been badly hit by the coronavirus. Import of footwear components from China has completely stopped since January. Now, the supply of components from Italy and Spain are not possible. We are running out of stocks. Soon, it will start affecting manufacturing of finished footwear.”Industry sources say raw material worth Rs 15 crore for manufacturing finished footwear is imported from different parts of China to Agra every month, which has completely stopped.AFMEC vice-president Rajesh Sehgal said he fears 50% drop in the export business. “Probably, many of us would end up being bankrupt if the situation continues like this for next few weeks and our orders are cancelled,” he added.Agra had exported footwear worth Rs 4,000 crore in the last financial year. Out of these, around Rs 3000 crore exports were to the European countries and remaining to the US and several African countries. According to AFMEC, Agra has around 10,000 micro-size units, 30 medium-scale units and around 15 large-scale units. On an average, more than two lakh pairs of shoes are manufactured in the city every day and there are over 3.5 lakh people employed in the footwear segment in Agra.

Title: Pole falls on Jhanda Mela gathering, 8 injured
Content:
According to an old tradition, a new flag is hoisted on the 105-feet-long pole every three years to mark the b... Read More

Dehradun: Panic struck the historical Jhanda Mela celebration in Dehradun when the flag pole that was being installed broke and fell on the people gathered at the spot, injuring around eight.

The incident took place around 4.30 pm on Friday when a new flag was being mounted on the pole. Eyewitnesses said that such an incident has never occurred before and that it took place this year because of the heavy downpour.

Talking to TOI, Bhupinder Ratudi, senior public relations officer at Mahant Shri Indiresh Hospital said, “The incident is unfortunate, but right now the situation is under control. The ceremony resumed later in the evening and the flag was mounted after administering treatment to the injured.”

Surjit Singh, 50, a resident of Solan, Himachal Pradesh, was among the people injured. “We were celebrating unaware what was coming up. We did not have a scope react or even run away when the pole fell on us. However, with the blessings of our Guru no one was severely injured and the celebrations went well.”

According to an old tradition, a new flag is hoisted on the 105-feet-long pole every three years to mark the beginning of the Jhanda Mela.

One of the largest fairs of Northern India, Jhanda Mela begins on the fifth day after Holi. It is celebrated as the birthday of Shri Guru Ram Rai Ji who travelled to Doon valley from Punjab and established his settlement ‘Dera’. Also, the city got its name “Dehradun” from thereon. Gurudwara Durbar Sahib where the fair takes place now was built by Shri Guru Ram Rai Ji. Thousands of devotees (known as sangat) come from neighbouring states and foreign countries to pay reverence to Shri Guru Ram Rai Ji Maharaj.

Title: Body of boy who slipped into canal 4 days ago found
Content:
Vadodara: Four days after he drowned in Narmada Canal near Chhani while trying to make a video, the fire brigade found the body of 16-year-old Arbaaz Pathan on Friday. The body was found near Bhimpura canal 5km away from the spot of drowning by the rescue team that had been searching for him since Tuesday. Fire officials later handed over his body to the grieving family.

“The water flow dragged him far away from the spot. On Friday morning, we got a call from a local that he had spotted a body floating near Bhimpura gate of the canal,” said Om Jadeja, fire officer.

The locals fished out the body and handed it over to the police and fire brigade. A resident of Navayard, Pathan was a Class X student who was appearing in his Board exams. He had gone to the canal on Tuesday afternoon with his friends on the occasion of Dhuleti. While recording a video standing on the canal’s bank, he accidentally stepped on a slippery surface and lost balance and fell into the gushing waters.

His friends who were sitting nearby, rushed in to help and when they couldn’t rescue him they called the fire brigade. Pathan’s father drives an auto rickshaw while his mother is a homemaker.

Title: Coronavirus in Andhra Pradesh: 102 persons with travel history to coronavirus-hit nations ‘missing’
Content:
More on Covid-19

VIJAYAWADA: Medical and health department officials are on the lookout for 102 persons who came in contact with people with suspected Covid-19 infection.Of the 666 people in the state with a travel history to coronavirus-affected nations, 102 are ‘untraceable’, officials said, adding that of the 564 persons under observation, 233 have crossed the observation period of 28 days.As of now, 331 persons are still under observation, 12 persons are admitted to various hospitals in the state, and the remaining are under home observation.As many as 55 samples were tested, of which 47 came out negative while one turned out to be positive. The test results of the remaining seven are pending.KS Jawahar Reddy, special chief secretary (health), told TOI that over 100 people who returned to the state from coronavirus-affected countries are yet to be traced.“We are making extra efforts with support of other departments to trace them. The untraced cases are due to either not having phone numbers or residential address. Medical and health officials are also collecting data from airport authorities, ports and a few others departments to trace the 102 ‘missing’ persons,” he added.Village volunteers have launched a door-to-door survey to identify those who arrived in the state after February 10 from others countries.

Title: Contain the spread: Int’l carriers cancel operations from city till March-end
Content: Visakhapatnam: International flights from Visakhapatnam International Airport have been cancelled as part of measures to contain the spread of coronavirus . Visakhapatnam is presently connected to Dubai, Singapore and Kuala Lumpur.Scoot airline, which operates a direct night flight from Visakhapatnam to Singapore five days a week (Sunday, Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday) has cancelled the Saturday flight till March-end and the flight for March 16 (Monday).Air Asia operates a direct flight from Visakhapatnam to Kuala Lumpur four days a week (Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday).The airline has cancelled operations for Tuesdays and Saturdays.There was no confirmation of flight cancellation from Air India which operates a daily flight from Visakhapatnam to Dubai.Speaking to TOI, K Vijay Mohan, president of Tours and Travels Association of Andhra Pradesh said, “The online booking for the Singapore flight and Air Asia flight are no more visible on the days it remains cancelled. Scoot officials have also informed that the airline is most likely to operate twice a week.”Meanwhile, some domestic flights from Visakhapatnam have been added, effective from this summer.Indigo will operate a Chennai-Visakhapatnam flight and add two flights—Vizag-Vijayawada and Vizag-Mumbai—this summer. Air Asia India will operate a third daily flight between Bengaluru and Visakhapatnam and another flight on the Visakhapatnam-Hyderabad route.

Title: Externment notice to green activist for ‘targeting’ SoU projects
Content:
Vadodara: The sub-divisional magistrate (SDM), Rajpipla, has issued a notice to a Paryavaran Suraksha Samiti (PSS) activist asking him why he shouldn’t be externed from five districts including Narmada, Bharuch, Vadodara, Chhota Udepur and Tapi for two years.

The notice follows Narmada superintendent of police filing a complaint against Lakhan Musafir, a resident of Garudeshwar taluka of Narmada, accusing him of spreading misinformation and creating roadblocks in government works.

Musafir has also been accused of raising slogans against the government that is executing different tourism projects near the Statue of Unity (SoU) in Kevadia. The complaint states that the activist with the help of some anti-social elements has also attacked people who have opposed his actions.

Musafir has been accused of targeting SoU and also picking up fight with the government as well as the Sardar Sarovar Narmada Nigam Ltd (SSNL) employees. The complaint also mentions two FIRs registered against him at Kevadia police station last year for criminal conspiracy, assaulting public servants and provoking breach of peace.

The activist has been asked to appear for hearing before the SDM in April.

PSS activist, Rohit Prajapati, however, has rubbished the accusations levelled against Musafir and termed him as a Gandhian. “Lakhan has done lot of good work for the locals by helping them in organic farming, bio-gas plants, education and supporting rights of the tribal families affected by Garudeshwar weir and SoU tourism projects,” Prajapati told TOI. “Musafir is opposed to displacing villagers for SoU tourism projects,” Prajapati added.

Title: Factory, scrap godown go up in flames
Content:
Ludhiana: A factory and an adjoining scrap godown on Tibba Road were reduced to ashes in a major fire that broke out early on Friday.

Nobody was hurt in the incident as the unit was closed at that time and the factory owner and his family who lived on first floor of the premises managed to come out safely.

The exact cause of fire and its origin are yet to be ascertained.

The fire officials claimed that they received a call at 4.40am about fire in Sharma Processor in Guru Gobind Singh Nagar near Satsang Ghar on Tibba road. The firemen claimed that when they reached, the flames had already spread in the unit and scrap items kept in the adjoining plot had caught fire. The fire in the factory was controlled in a few hours, but fire fighters had to put extra efforts to douse flames in scrap godown. It took a long time to arrange earthmoving machines to remove scrap.

Fire tenders made 30-35 rounds to fetch water. There was arrangement for water in the factory.

Sub-fire officer Aatish Rai said, “When we reached the site, the flames had engulfed the ground floor of the unit completely and spread to scrap godown. The fire in unit was controlled, but it took long to douse flames in the scrap godown as it had flammable material.”

He said it is not clear how fire started, but there is a possibility that sparks might have started from a mobile tower installed on the terrace of the factory because of thunderstorm and lighting on Thursday night.

The fire was controlled in almost seven-and-a-half hours.

Panic in the area

The incident triggered panic in the locality as it was a residential area. People gathered near the incident site and even recorded it in their mobile phones. The firemen had to make extra efforts to keep people away from the site.

Refilling of fire tenders took a long time

The fire incident took place on Tibba Road and the nearest fire station was in Sunder Nagar. The fire officials claimed that in the early morning, it was still easier to refill the fire tenders due to lesser traffic at Basti Jodhewal chowk, but the day progressed, fire tenders took almost 40 minutes to again the spot from Sunder Nagar fire station. After the Basti Jodhewal flyover has become operational, there is no median or cut from Tibba Road up to Samrala Chowk. So, fire tenders had to take U-turn from Samrala Chowk to reach Sunder Nagar and then Tibba Road.

Title: Political drama in Madhya Pradesh takes a new twist
Content:
Cops keep vigil outside MP assembly on Friday.

BHOPAL: The political drama in Madhya Pradesh took a new twist on Friday when 19 Congress MLAs of the rebel Scindia faction, including six ministers, were reported to be heading for Bhopal from Bengaluru. After seven hours of suspense, it turned out that the Bhopal trip was cancelled and they could be flown to Delhi.

Sources said BJP MLAs Ramakant Bhargava, Arvind Bhadoria and rebel Congress MLAs Suresh Dhakad, Jaswant Jatav, Imarti Devi, Manoj Chaudhary , Aindal Singh Kansana and Raksha Sironia were to arrive in Bhopal in a chartered plane. In another special flight, former BJP minister Umashankar Gupta, and Congress MLAs Tulsi Silawat, Govind Singh Rajput, Pradyumn Singh Tomar, Prabhuram Chaudhary, Rajyawardhan Singh Dattigaon , Mahendra Singh Sisodia and Kamlesh Jatav were to arrive. Three others — Punit Sharma, Mohan Singh and Raksha’s husband Santram — were to come in one of these two flights, said sources.

MP political crisis live updates

“I was asked to pick up all 19 MLAs at the airport on their arrival from Bengaluru. However, I am leaving the airport after reports that their arrival has been postponed,” said a senior BJP state functionary, adding that the 19 legislators had arrived at Bengaluru airport but returned to the resort.

Twenty-two Congress legislators had resigned on March 10 after Jyotiraditya Scindia quit Congress. BJP leader Bhupendra Singh carried resignations of 19 of them to Speaker Narmada Prasad Prajapati. On Thursday, the Speaker issued notices to the 22 Congress dissidents to appear before him to confirm if they had resigned voluntarily or under duress.

The Speaker had asked six MLAs to appear on Friday, seven on Saturday and the remaining nine on Sunday.

Title: 1,840 clear GSET, set to be teachers in Gujarat
Content:
Representative image

VADODARA: A total of 1 ,840 candidates from across the state have qualified for the Gujarat State Eligibility Test ( GSET ) results of which were declared on Friday.

The 14th GSET which is conducted for determining the eligibility for the post of assistant professor in universities and colleges of Gujarat was held in December last year. A record number of candidates — 25,423 had appeared in GSET of which 1,840 qualified giving 7.24% pass result. M S University is the nodal agency for conducting GSET in Gujarat.

“The results are better compared to 13th GSET held in September 2018. A total of 1,595 out of 24,471 candidates who had appeared for the test had qualified giving 6.51 % result during the 13th edition of the exam,” said professor C N Murthy, member secretary of GSET.Maximum number of candidates who have qualified this year are from commerce stream followed by candidates from chemistry and life science stream.

GSET was conducted in 23 subjects at 11 centres across the state.

Title: Trio loots driver in Waghodia, flee with his taxi
Content:
Accused in police custody

Vadodara: Waghodia police on Friday arrested a man in connection with a loot case filed by an employee of a private ridesharing company.

Mrugesh Soral, 32, a resident of Waghodia Road, who works as a driver told the police that three persons looted him and fled with his car on Thursday night.

According to the police, Soral was waiting outside Vadodara railway station to get passengers on Thursday night. The accused trio told him that they wanted to travel to Waghodia following which Soral agreed to ferry them for Rs 600. The trio sat in the car and after they reached Waghodia crossroads, one of the accused told Soral to turn the car towards Goraj village.

After travelling for sometime, one of them asked Soral to stop the car as he wanted to buy tobacco from a roadside stall. Later, the accused asked him to stop the taxi again as they wanted to relieve themselves. The trio returned within few minutes and suddenly accosted Soral with two of them forcing Soral to sit in the passengers seat while the third drove the car.

Soral told the cops that the accused asked him to hand over cash and any valuables he had. Soral gave them Rs 3,000 in cash, his watch and two debit cards. They then took the car to an ATM booth so that they could withdraw money from Soral’s bank account using his debit card. When one of the accused, Rizwan Mahida, went in the ATM booth, Soral raised alarm following which the other two fled with his car.

Soral caught hold of Mahida with the help of some passers-by. Mahida told the police that he is a resident of Anand. Of the two who fled, one has been identified as Usman Chauhan while the third is yet to be identified. Soral got back his mobile phone, wrist watch and debit card from Mahida.

Title: Covid-19 scare: Dip in Tirumala Hundi collections
Content: TIRUPATI: Coronavirus fears have hit the revenues of the richest temple in the country, with the Lord Venkateswara temple in Tirumala reporting its lowest-ever single day Hundi collections of the year — Rs 2.1 crore — on Friday.Following advisories from the central and state governments, the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams has appealed to devotees from abroad to plan their pilgrimage to Tirupati 28 days after landing in the country.In January, TTD received Rs 92.09 crore as Hundi collections, including a highest single day collection of Rs 4.13 crore on Jan 24.The lowest single day collection of the year was Rs 2.12 crore on Jan 17.In February, the TTD received Rs 88.85 crore, including a highest single day collection of Rs 4.41 crore on Feb 19 and a lowest of Rs 2.2 crore on Feb 2.

Title: Bengaluru: Not paid during maternity leave, say pourakarmikas
Content:
BBMP’s foot soldiers complain of a raw deal

BENGALURU: BBMP women pourakarmikas have alleged that they aren’t being paid salaries during the six-month maternity leave that they are eligible for.

Pregnant women pourakarmikas are allowed leave, two months before delivery and four months after. Though they are eligible to be paid during the period, most go without salary, a pourakarmika union leader said and added that BBMP officials claim they don’t have enough funds to pay employees on maternity leave.

Also, when these civic workers want to rejoin work post maternity leave, they are made to run from pillar to post.

“A colleague of mine has gone to her mother’s place for delivery, but she has not been paid for the last two months. I have been told it is our right to receive salaries when we are on maternity leave,” a pourakarmika said on condition of anonymity. “We don’t know who will resolve our grievances,” she added.

According to the pourakarmika, many of her women colleagues hide their pregnancies till the last minute as they want to reduce the leave period so that they can keep drawing salaries, keeping in mind the expenses that follow childbirth.

“Many pregnant women do not get paid. We all know that a pregnant woman should eat nutritious food, for which you need money. Then there are ceremonies post childbirth, which too require money. The authorities should consider these factors.”

However, a BBMP official said there could be a few cases of pourakarmikas not being paid salaries during the maternity leave period, but nothing has come to their notice as of now.

The pourakarmikas are broadly divided into two categories — ‘permanent’ and ‘contract’ employees. Employees who were under the ‘contract’ system earlier are now classified as ‘direct’ staffers by the Palike. “Pourakarmikas classified as ‘permanent’ get paid without any hassles as per BBMP rules. There are about 15,000 ‘direct’ pourakarmikas and are the ones who might be facing this maternity leave related issue. However, all these employees can avail maternity benefits at ESI Hospitals. A part of their wage goes to these hospitals,” the official said.

S Vanajja, a pourakarmika, however, insisted that they aren’t paid while on maternity leave. “After some of us took up the issue, wages were paid to two of our colleagues. But why should we fight for it? It’s our right,” she said.

S Balan, president of Guttige Pourakarmikara Sangha, said no pourakarmika has received maternity leave benefits. “They tell them they’d provide them with insurance cover but in most cases the payment is not done. These civic workers aren’t treated well,” he added.

Title: Govt orders valuation of jewellery in 11 T temples
Content:
Hyderabad: The Telangana government has issued orders approving the reports of jewellery appraisement and valuation of 11 prominent temples in the state.

The records will be sent to state archives in Tarnaka. The move is aimed at creating better records to avoid the allegations of misuse of temple jewellery .

On March 6, Revenue and Endowments department issued 11 GOs approving the description report of jewellery verification officer of the temples.

Sri Venkateshwara Swamy temple in Srinagar Colony, Hyderabad, Sri Raja Rajeshwara Swamy devasthanam in Vemulawada in Rajanna-Sircilla district, Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy temple in Medak district and Kodanda Ramachandra Swamy temple in Nizamabad were among the temples for which valuation was completed.

Jewellery appraisement in temples in Rangareddy, Nizamabad, Jangaon and Suryapet districts has also been done.

Title: One year after tragedy, crashed CSMT bridge yet to be rebuilt
Content: MUMBAI: March 14 marks one year since the collapse of the Himalaya foot over bridge at the northern end of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus ( CSMT ) that killed seven people. The BMC has still not begun reconstructing an FOB at the site despite continuous movement of pedestrians who enter and exit the railway terminus. Till date, the staircase of the erstwhile FOB stands at the site.Civic bridges department officials said design plans for a new FOB have already been submitted to the Mumbai Heritage Conservation Committtee (MHCC). “We had submitted three designs to MHCC and we are yet to receive a nod from them about which one has been approved,” said R Talkar, BMC chief engineer in charge of the bridges department. Talkar refused to divulge any more information.When contacted, an MHCC member said they got the proposal last month and that a design had been approved. “The minutes of the meeting will be discussed at the upcoming MHCC meeting,” said an official.Shiv Sena’s Sujata Sanap, the local corporator from the area, said she has repeatedly raised her concerns regarding the absence of an FOB at a busy crossing. “Commuters are continuously rushing into the station as they fear they may miss a train even if there is a minute delay. The BMC should consider all this and immediately construct an FOB that would benefit the public,” she said.Meanwhile, corporators across Mumbai said several bridges declared dilapidated and shut in the aftermath of Himalaya FOB collapse are still under construction or have been kept open solely for light motor vehicles.

Title: Another doctor ends life in Hyderabad, 3rd since February
Content:
Dr G Subhash

HYDERABAD: Suicides by doctors in the city in the last one-and-a-half months continued with another doctor — a cardiologist at a hospital in Secunderabad — taking his life at his Kompally home on Friday.

Dr G Subhash (33) was found dead in his room by his parents at around 9 am. Cops, however, are not sure about the cause of death. Petbasheerabad police, who registered a suspicious death case, suspect he might have taken the extreme step owing to differences with his wife who, in the past few months, had been living separately.

When Dr Subhash’s parents went to his room to wake him up, they found him lying in an unconscious state. They rushed him to a nearby hospital where doctors declared him brought dead.

Police said the doctor did not leave behind any suicide note. “There were issues between him and his wife. We suspect that was the trigger for Dr Subhash to end his life,” Petbasheerabad sub-inspector M Parasuram said. Police said Dr Subhash got married in Arya Samaj in 2017.
